Reviews: Dr Stein and his practice came highly recommended from my husband's (MD) colleagues- and it's hard to argue with his amazing success rates! After months of trying to conceive unsuccessfully, and in light of my husband beginning chemotherapy and my history of endometriosis, Dr Stein went over all of our options in great detail From the first meeting, his staff and colleagues told us everything we could expect from timelines and treatments all the way down to medications Absolutely no corners were cut before and during the pandemic- the team was so incredibly thorough conducting every possible test and taking every possible precaution throughout all treatments We are very fortunate that our first embryo transfer was a success, and owe it all to Dr Stein and his wonderful team! Even as we graduate to the absolutely perfect OB Dr Stein recommended, RMA continues to check in to see how baby and I are doing While we know many couples do not have the same success as us so quickly, I cannot imagine a more positive, compassionate, and personally involved team to help start our family Highly recommendWe are so grateful for Dr Flisser, Ariel Schnur, and the team at RMA for our healthy pregnancy - due May 2020 What we liked about RMA might also be what some don't like about it But we had nothing but thoughtful care through many ups and downs and most importantly, we were successful My pregnancy and baby has been healthy every step of the way and we couldn't be happier, or more grateful and we can't wait to meet our little one Dr Flisser always greeted me with a smile and took the time to answer our questions (and we had many!) as we went through each cycle Throughout the process I had full confidence in Dr Flisser's medical expertise and his varying approach to each cycle, and highly recommend him for IVFI had been struggling with a recent LEEP, PCOS, hypothyroidism and it seemed like the entire process of trying to get pregnant was filled with nothing but hurdles  Luckily, I was referred to RMA of New York and I am extremely grateful to Dr Stein and the RMA nurses and staff for their care and support on this journey  Dr Stein made me feel at ease during our very first meeting and was very patient and supportive, answering all of my questions and reassuring me that they can provide the help that I needMy wife and I feel very good in this place where they really help you and explain you step by step, thanks to Dr Carlos Hernandez Nieto who made us feel that we are in very good handsThanks to Dr Mukherjee I am now pregnant with our first little boy due this summer! We had a great experience at RMA & highly recommend Dr Mukherjee Although not every visit was the news we had wanted, their nurses offered so much physical and emotional support as we were going through IVF which was draining and felt like it was going nowhereFrom our first appt, Dr Lawrence Grunfeld was realistic, highly educated, and had an excellent bedside mannerWhile I know success is never guaranteed, my husband and I were really losing hope after years of trying for a family Go see Dr Grunfeld so he can help you figure out howAfter so many years of infertility, I knew I would get pregnant with Dr Grunfeld and his team of nurses We our persistence & Dr Grunfeld expertise, we got pregnant and had twin girls Good luck getting a phone call having someone follow up with you, there is a general number you call were you are placed on hold for a while until they decided to respond  Your physician does not typically work with you after the consultation there are doctors who deal with the hundreds of cycling patients so its a crap shoot essentially (you may get a decent doctor you may not they dont care at all) They get results or positive pregnancies due to volume of around 500+ woman at any given time,however i would not be surprised at all if they artificially inflated the numbers to lure vulnerable women into that place! It is here in the initial experience that much is lost I actually commented on this "factory feel" while the Dr was in the room and a nurse mentioned that "they were really trying to get away from that sense Often emails went unanswered and I would write back multiple times to get an answerexplain what's going on during this process The human touch would help when a woman is allowing a device inside of her I am NOT a doctor, but the logic hit me and I would have at least appreciated having the discussion before the process beganand was never able to tell us why he was azoospermic In Australia, our urologist sat with both of us and talked about the male body, physiology, etc for about half an hour We spent nearly a year at RMA trying to understand the infertility issues and were never given a reasonFor over the 10 years I have been trying to have children with several failed IVF, I pray that God answer my prayer through RMA I'll  highly recommend RMA  to family and friendsDr Flisser at the RMA of NYC (Eastside) is fantastic! He's patient with his examinations and has a really calm demeanor which puts me at ease (unlike some other doctors who rush their patients through a 15 minute slot) I was on the thyroid medication on recommendation from Dr Flisser when we got pregnant with our first baby (after an earlier miscarriage a year prior)  We highly recommend Dr Stein and RMANY!!!Dr Murherjee was very professional, compassionate and knowledgeable He was able to get me pregnant after 5 1/2 years of trying with no success He also took the time to answer all of our questions I highly recommend that anyone who is having infertility issues go to him Dr Beth McAvey and her team of nurses helped my husband and I fulfill our dream of children not once but twice They run a busy office but I always felt taken care of and supported If I didn't feel comfortable with something they were eager to rectify the issue I have had many friends go through IVF and the full waiting room is something that comes along with the territory no matter where you go, for the most part I'm so happy that we went to RMA I can not recommend them enoughDr Lekovich was phenomenal She provided the perfect balance of science and compassion as she explained her strategy and approach each visit I'm 41 and we where successful on our first IVF attempt with Dr Lekovich It may be down to some luck but she was confident and knew what she was doing given our situation Highly recommendThey intentionally fail your cycle so you keep doing it 3/4 times Being treated well at 7 aDr Copperman and Jordyn Banks, RN-BSN go above and beyond for their patients--super thorough, kind, responsive, and happy to explain anything Highly recommend!Had a good experience here with Dr Flisser Also, it turns out our infertility was related to some very serious undiagnosed medical issues (liver failure) on my husband's part He's doing okay now, but the doctor he saw there (I can't remember his name) was much more interested in fixing the infertility than finding out what was causing itI saw Dr Copperman here (Jordyn Banks was his dedicated nurse/my contact)  Both were highly responsive and patient with me as I made decisions and dealt with any setbacks Yes, there are a lot of patients, but I still felt like I received one-on-one care and treatment We used Dr Copperman and I can't recommend him enough What I appreciate is that before they begin any exam, discuss details about next steps in person or draw any blood, they have us verify the name and DOB to ensure it's the correct patient I was a patient of Dr F and cornered into doing 3 IVF treatments with him before realising that the treatments are not tailor made to my body Your dr will also not be the one who does the retrieval My husband was shocked to see the back of my hospital gown and legs soaked with blood because I drew the short straw and had a trainee dr do my egg retrievalDr Copperman was real straightforward and resourceful in the information he provided me! Highly recommend him to anyone!My first experience at RMA was great largely due to the thorough, thoughtful, caring and informative care I received at the hands of Dr Leigh Rosen, M Now that I know what it feels like to have an elite doctor and 5 star service, I'm NEVER settling for less again Some may say that they feel like a number because there are so many patients but it's NYC and that is to be expected And I HIGHLY recommend Dr Flisser He is incredibly knowledgeable and my husband and I both agree that he is by far the best physician either of us have experienced in the city He has a calm demeanor to him and no question is too crazy Dr Thornton is kind and was upfront with us Highly recommend I have yet to hear from my physician and I have called her three times I was referred by a colleague and now would like to question exactly what they saw in this group During my time there, I was treated kindly, well informed and truly, like a person I was able to voice any feelings, concerns and questions and anything I needed was provided  I'm successfully and happily pregnant but honestly wish I could ride out my entire pregnancy at this office I'd recommend Dr Lederman, Dr Klein, and the amazing Martha Fennessey to my family, friends, and strangers alikeIs this a pill mill, but for fertility drugs?I didn't have a known fertility issue but was ready to start planning to conceive and was open to taking a treatment of some sort to speed things up I ended up going here for a couple of months and then stoppedMy first visit was very encouraging and I liked the doctor, who seemed knowledgeable and caringWhen I was told to come in to see a doctor, the doctor said she was just there for an ultrasound and this was not a visit for talking about stuffAt first, I thought it was a really streamlined operation; then I felt like I was on an assembly line I felt like I was just money to them If I had a real complication or issue it would feel stressful dealing with them Do your own research on effectiveness, side effects, number of times it is advisable to have certain treatments, etc I ended up getting pregnant on my own shortly after I left there, likely because I had a better sense of my ovulation cycle for which I can thank them Was a pleasure meeting & treating with himAfter 3 miscarriages, I decided that it was time to see a fertility doctor I met with Dr Flisser, who was very understanding and explained his opinions and my options In the first set of tests they found out I had a thyroid issue, sent me a prescription and referred me to an endocrinologist Dr Flisser saw me until my 8th week and was so nice and explained everythingMy husband and I had an amazing experience with RMA!  Dr Flisser was our doctor through the entire process  I suffer from PCOS and have been struggling to get pregnant for a few years  And we got pregnant after just one IUI!!  Amazing!!  If you are suffering from infertility, please visit RMA, please see Dr FlisserDespite going through the ups and downs of infertility, Dr Copperman and his team were PHENOMENAL during the whole process Dr Copperman and his team were extremely responsive during my entire process - from my emails full of questions to showing up to lend their support on my transfer day I found Dr Copperman to be very caring, knowledgeable and realistic There is alot of emotion and stress that comes along with IVF, but I felt extremely cared for at RMA I highly recommend it!Dr Flisser and his team are truly professionalI'm extremely upset at Dr Flisser Back in 2015 he helped me conceive my first baby (which I'm very thankful ) This morning I went to RMA for an ultrasound because I'm currently having an ectopic pregnancy (from a frozen transfer with Dr Stein) I asked the nurse to see Dr Flisser because I used to feel comfortable with him and he was doing the monitoring but he refused to see meGoing through fertility treatment is a difficult thing  Whether your case is diagnosed or undiagnosed it's a stressful time for anyone experiencing it I gave birth to a healthy baby boy at the end of January and am grateful to the science, medicine and consultation provided by Dr Grunfeld and his team  I highly recommend going to this practice!Having been through many many cycles of IVF and having experienced a number of IVF Centers in NYC, I wanted to provide a review of my experience at RMA and with Dr Alan Copperman  Firstly, I know most reviews cannot help but be influenced by the outcome, and I am the same  We now have 3 beautiful children, all through working with Dr Copperman and RMA  My 5 star rating doesn't mean that the center is perfect, but I would strongly recommend it given my experience there and elsewhereI found Dr Copperman to be caring, responsive and of course highly experienced and knowledgeable  I appreciated that he took time to listen to and address my questions/concerns and even suggestions, given that after multiple go's, I felt I knew how my body responded to certain medications and timings  While IVF is highly scientific, there is also an art/skill in the protocol and timings, and I felt that Dr Copperman took all of my history into regard and adjusted the protocols etc as we went through to try to deliver the best outcome, and even listened to my input  (Retrievals are still done by doctor on duty given that it is highly time-sensitive)So all in all, I would strongly recommend Dr Copperman and RMA - we have referred a number of friends and are extremely grateful for what they were able to do for usWe had a wonderful experience with Dr Flisser and the whole team at RMA  Our appointments with Dr Flisser were great - he has a warm but serious demeanor and we felt very reassured  Would highly recommend RMA and Dr Flisser After hearing so many good things about Dr Flisser, I visited him with unique fertility concerns as well as severe chronic migraines (and medication to prevent them) that complicated my strong desire for a family  I was spinning with several fears and questions even before starting the planning process, and Dr Flisser answered every single one  I had!  Over the next months, Dr Flisser tailored my fertility plan both to minimize my chronic pain, and to prepare for a healthy baby  I was continually impressed and, honestly, astonished by how quickly and thoroughly Dr Flisser responds to questions and concerns My husband and I are now thrilled to be expecting a healthy baby in three months, and I have Dr Flisser and RMA NY to thank  She is extremely knowledgeable and approachableI went to NYC RMA last month and saw DrFlisser who told me I had to lose 16 pounds before he would start treatment I said well Drflisser told me I needed to lose 16 pounds to start treatment I spoke to a friend of the family who referred me to Kofinas fertility group in Methodist hospitalI am not writing this because I am unhappy with the unsuccessful results of my treatment over two IVF cycles; I came into the IVF process at almost 40 years old eyes wide open that it very well could not work Rather, my issue with RMA which I feel the need to bring to everyone's attention is with the substandard and disappointing service and care I received   My doctor (Dr Flisser) called and spoke with my husband and I about my results    What a horrible thing to do to someone who still three years later has not gotten pregnant I am so grateful to Dr Flisser and the office staff for such a wonderful and smooth experience As someone who unfortunately has needed IVF treatments several times and gone through two different facilities and providers, RMANY has really been excellent Dr Flisser has been an amazing provider Not only is he so well knowledges but his bedside manner is impeccable  He is very  warm and makes you feel comfortable and heard as a patient going through an extremely anxiety-provoking time  I would highly recommend RMANY and Dr FlisserI began seeing Dr Flisser last summer as my husband and I were having issues conceiving naturally We will definitely be returning when we are ready for #2! Thank you to Dr Flisser, Ariel and the staff at RMA! Get past the overwhelming feeling during morning monitoring - the care I received really was amazing and I highly recommend RMA EastsideFirst I'd like to add that the Doctor's at RMA are top notch, especially Dr Stein  Dr Stein made have the worst anxiety because I never felt he was interested in making it happen with usIf I could give Dr Copperman and his amazing team 100 stars, it would not be enough  If  I had not been lucky enough to switch to Dr Copperman, I might have given up and not have had the most perfect baby boy  I had been recommended to RMA by my doctor and others originally, but at the time they did not accept my insurance  We were just fortunate enough to complete our family with our baby girl and I will never be able to thank Dr Copperman enough for creating my family Dr Flisser was very, kind, understanding, patient and thorough as our doctor I also felt very comfortable with himI absolutely loved Dr Stein's team and all the doctors I saw during monitoringDoctor Tanmoy Mukherjee  made my dreams come true! I cannot thank him enough on how much he changed me and my family's life! I will definitely recommend him to everyone  I went for a consultation and I liked the dr I met, she was very kind and thorough (Dr Allison Styne)  I've also been seen with Dr Joshua U  On the way back, I felt horrible, but it didn't affect the results thank goodness!!   They DO NOT care about their patients, they only care about $$$$  They treat you like a number, not a person The nurses were very responsive and Dr Davis was amazing:First of all, Dr Davis is a very kind and welcoming person, which is supper important in his field In addition, he is very resourceful, intelligent, patient and respectfulDr Davis was also very responsive over email and helpful in any possible wayHighly recommend!! I feel frustrated a year later after going through all this, but I've come out an expert and will not be taking any more fertility meds which seem to cause stress to my thyroid Miscarriage after miscarriage is so upsetting You will find a very caring attention to detail at every interaction Dr Stein and Dr Bar-Chama are the doctors that other doctors use for themselves and their family The Dr took us through the whole process, did an ultrasound, made it all sound super easy and hopeful We felt totally duped  I saw my actual Dr at consultation and one other time when he was doing the rounds  The Dr actually explains your situation comprehensively during consultation She is reachable by EMAIL and she, the Dr, responds! Some doctors are okay, but overall it's not a personal experience and you feel more like a number than a patienthow can I think about the wild range of reviews other than:(1) you love RMA if you got pregnant with a healthy baby (on the first try), or(2) you didn't?we are grateful every time we look at our rock star 3-year old, and are fully aware that Dr Flisser is to thank for him  Dr Flisser is extremely patient, thorough and has an excellent bedside manner  I never felt rushed and always felt like we were in good handsI had the most wonderful things to say about RMA in the beginning but to make a long story even longer:By by third IVF, and each time I emailed and met with my doctor, there was no answer as to what was going on (i why we couldn't get pregnant)I'm not even bitter at the fact that all three IVF's were unsuccessful, just bitter that no one told us what was REALLY going on I went for my second ultrasound and saw Dr Jovana Lekovich She made me second experience at RMA very unpleasant with her abrasive bedside mannerI was referred to a doctor at this practice for endocrinology and not for anything fertility based by my OBGYN 2 years ago I was angry the first time, but figured there might have been a technical glitch where they confused me with another patient Dr Mcavey is just business woman Dr Copperman has awful bedside manner And they have done the same thing to many other patients (read the other reviews on yelp)Go to Cornell- I've gone there and it is much more caring and professional They treat their patients like patients, not like targetsI could not be more grateful to Dr Mukherjee and the staff at RMAIn the beginning of my fertility treatment, I felt that there was a bit of a factory feel to the practice  It is a true group practice, where you see many drs and you are communicating more with the nurses than the Dr during treatment  Also, in speaking with many other woman who go through fertility treatment in various clinics in NYC, I learned most of the popular ones have that factory feel as many woman need help  I felt they were rooting for me every step of the wayI had met many of the drs during the treatment and I liked most  Every dr has a different doctoring style, so some personalities and styles meshed more with my needsDr Mukherjee was my main Dr, and the Dr who oversaw all my treatments  The entire fertility treatment process is difficult, it affects you physically, mentally, psychologically, emotionally and financially    I highly recommend RMA to call us back to explain the results and progress, he called us back within an hourRMA definitely feels like a fertility factory and you won't always get the warm and fuzzies here, but they're on top of it! IVF is a confusing and overwhelming process I always felt I was in good hands here We loved working with Dr Mukherjee! I would definitely recommend RMAIf I could give ZERO stars I would!! HORRIBLE!!! Talk about being treated like just another number!!! If you want to get pregnant & you're in NYC go to Sher with Dr T, Dr Dicken or Dr Wang!! They are the best!!! At the age of 36 and after trying for over a year and a half and after 2 IVFs, 1 FET transfer, & 4 IUIs, we finally discovered Sher  :) Dr Dicken was on maternity leave for the first IUI, so Dr T performed the 1st one and Dr Wang did my second IUI, both were great!!!! Dr Dicken is amazing, as are Dr T & Dr Wang! Dr Dicken sat with us for over an hour in the initial consultation and revamped my medication regiment to focus on egg quality rather than quantity  The doctors and nurses are all so warm & make you feel so comfortable At least they removed the charge after we got our family friend who is a lawyer involved and threatened legal actionDr K still rains supreme I'm so happy that I was able to conceive!I can't recommend RMA, and specifically Dr Copperman, highly enough  When you're going through the process, you get to know all the doctors depending on what day you need to come in, and there wasn't anyone I met who I didn't like  But Dr Copperman was "my" doctor and made what can be a difficult, emotional process so much easier  I genuinely felt like the whole staff was thrilled to see our success, and I cried on 'graduation day' when I was discharged (to, by the way, an OB who 'wasn't taking new patients' when I called until the doctor at RMA went above and beyond to get me in)  I had questions, but the receptionist told me someone could speak to me when I donated the sperm  Then I went to the office for my appt and they'd lost the fax again! After more conversation they then found it again  Then when I spoke with someone she told me that any sperm I donated that day couldn't be used for the egg/surrogate because I needed a physical first, which they couldn't do that daytl:dr: This place has decent doctors but terrible communication and awful staff The stress the latter two cause is enough to keep you from getting pregnant Yes, Dr Klein is pretty good, but the whole experience is terrible No one ever really answered my questions enough to where I felt comfortable going forward5 Stars! My husband and I had a very positive experience with RMA, both with the supporting staff and under the care of Dr Eric Flisser Upon my initial consultation, Dr Flisser spent over an hour speaking to me about my medical history, walking through potential options to help with conception and the associated factors to be aware of Furthermore, he helped thoroughly explain what was happening at each stage pre-conception and during early pregnancy in an honest and realistic way Upon leaving RMA to transfer to a regular OB, Dr Flisser went to great lengths to help us find a doctor that would be just right for our needs The nurse named Alyssa especially stood out for her personable touch to in-person meetings and calls But two weeks after they discharged us and my wife was evidently losing our baby, they couldn't have cared less First, let's talk about the waiting room After  a 45 minute wait I saw dr grunfeld Horrible bedside manners He barely looked at me and my husband and rushed us through the appt We then met with kim, the ivf coordinator and permanent bitch face lady If u want to feel like ur in a factory and don't want personal care, then by all means go hereI had a wonderful experience at RMA, specifically with Dr Copperman He is one of the most caring and knowledgeable doctors I have ever seen I saw him twice- for two different issues- and each time he remained calm, confident and reassuring I no way felt like I was a patient in a big practice Dr Copperman developed a personal relationship with me and made me feel like my case mattered He responds promptly to emails and even called me on one late Sunday night because he knew I was discouraged I highly recommend him and RMA I was shocked of course, but decided to countercheck: obviously they called the wrong place, and therefore got wrong information Dr Sandler called me back himself several times when I needed his consultation He helped to find an OB/GYN even though I didn't have mine, and it was extremely difficult to make an appointmentDr Daniel Stein is a funny, kind, hard-working guy whom I really liked They gave us bad advice regarding a rebate program (Compassionate Care) that could have saved us literally thousands of dollarsMy husband and I had a wonderful -- and most importantly, successful -- experience with RMA of NY  Dr Mukherjee was an excellent dr who is extremely positive and personable without sugar coating things In my view, going with a practice that sees hundreds of patients each year and pools together the knowledge and expertise of a dozen or more expert doctors is exactly what I want  Despite the largeness of the practice,i never had any trouble getting my questions answered or personal attention when needed The only time I spoke with my Dr after 1st consult was when he 'couldn't proceed' because of a missing paymentAfter 2 years of dealing with infertility, 5 IUI's, 2 miscarriages and a million tears   I My husband and I both went through a lot of tests  Dr Sandler and his team discussed the issues I was dealing with   He met with me a few times before we started the treatment   Both Ashlie and Kirsten  were my cheerleaders and my voice of reason Today I am 8 weeks pregnant with twins!  We heard their healthy hearts beating and I forgot all about the 2 years of torture I dealt with before meeting Dr SandlerDr Sandler is an honest, straight forward and an unbelievably smart doctor - there is no BS with him  I could not possibly recommend a doctor more than I recommend Dr Sandler and his team  He was an absolute godsend!  Me and my little family are graduating from RMA and I can honestly say, I do not want to leave! Thank you Dr Sandler you finally gave us our miracle(S)! Never going back We've since found much more caring and attentive practices and now prefer seeing a doctor who actually will care for you! Difficult as it is to find these days, the effort is worth it Dr Grunfeld was fantastic! He's the kind of doc you know, knows his stuff and its very comforting! Whilst we ended up falling pregnant naturally anyway (one month away from starting treatments!) we felt very comfortable he would have gotten us over the line  The whole donor process, under the best of circumstances, is highly emotional and undignified  It truly is like a factory  RMA never recommended that I speak to a therapist or seek any kind of emotional counseling, despite the complicated situation involved with receiving donated eggs  BUT there is no excuse for the staff's cold demeanor and their failure to treat patients as a human being  Their non-individualized approach to fertility patients is a dangerous, expensive mistake, and ultimately heartbreaking in the end I wish that these doctors saw me as more than a uterus and a checkbookI've been going here since July 2013 and tried to keep an open mind, but for a practice that handles such important and sensitive work, I've been really disappointed at the complete lack of compassion and care  I saw Dr Sandler and loved him  He explained things clearly to me, was proactive, and was reassuring without making any false promises  I always felt like I was in excellent hands, even at the time when things were not looking good for usI started treatment at RMA in April 2014 at the Westchester office with Dr Jeff Klein, due to a recommendation from a friend, who had been to Cornell and had a terrible experience You can tell when you meet with him that he became a RE because he truly cares and will do whatever is in his power to help you I have never met a more compassionate and dedicated Dr and my husband absolutely agrees! The fact that he personally answers your emails and in an extremely timely manner is something that is very unheard of in this field When you go to a Dr as frequently as you do for fertility treatment, you really get to know all the players I would actually look forward to going to see them! My husband also really felt this way about the staff and enjoyed going to the office I can never repay Dr Klein and his entire staff for not only helping me to get pregnant but for all the support along the way I needed a solid treatment plan, fast appointments (since I went either before work or during lunch hour), and responses to my emails/calls when needed  I absolutely LOVE Dr Mukherjee and feel more comfortable with him than my regular (female) OB The RN staff is very friendly and always follows up and I can simply request an appointment with Dr M to go over options Small side note - if you have PCOS and are slightly overweight and are absolutely sick and tired of every RE telling you to lose weight when you've been trying really hard to do just that - Dr Mukherjee is absolutely awesome in that respect He simply trusts that you're doing your best, gives you a few suggestions (once!) and focuses on getting you pregnant rather than stuffed with kale and celery  Further, the original plan of taking the injection for 3 nights, skipping a night, then coming in 36 hours later for ultrasound/labs didnt make sense such that I called the office BACK to ensure those were the instructions, They were repeated to me in the same way, so that's what I didMy wife and I had a very good experience here with Dr Allison Styne and Amber Madsen was our nurse  If you are trying to get pregnant I highly recommend RMA of NY  Every time I received IUI, I was allowed to stay there only 10 minutes and I always felt as if was rushed out And I would never recommend to a friend From the time I entered the office I felt like a number I have NEVER even posted a review on yelp
summary: Dr Stein and his practice came highly recommended from my husband's (MD) colleagues- and it's hard to argue with his amazing success rates! to family and friendsDr Flisser at the RMA of NYC (Eastside) is fantastic! He's patient with his examinations and has a really calm demeanor which puts me at ease (unlike some other doctors who rush their patients through a 15 minute slot) I was on the thyroid medication on recommendation from Dr Flisser when we got pregnant with our first baby (after an earlier miscarriage a year prior) . Dr Flisser was our doctor through the entire process . I suffer from PCOS and have been struggling to get pregnant for a few years . And we got pregnant after just one IUI!! . Firstly, I know most reviews cannot help but be influenced by the outcome, and I am the same . We now have 3 beautiful children, all through working with Dr Copperman and RMA . Would highly recommend RMA and Dr Flisser After hearing so many good things about Dr Flisser, I visited him with unique fertility concerns as well as severe chronic migraines (and medication to prevent them) that complicated my strong desire for a family . Over the next months, Dr Flisser tailored my fertility plan both to minimize my chronic pain, and to prepare for a healthy baby . What a horrible thing to do to someone who still three years later has not gotten pregnant I am so grateful to Dr Flisser and the office staff for such a wonderful and smooth experience As someone who unfortunately has needed IVF treatments several times and gone through two different facilities and providers, RMANY has really been excellent Dr Flisser has been an amazing provider Not only is he so well knowledges but his bedside manner is impeccable . Thank you to Dr Flisser, Ariel and the staff at RMA! Dr Stein made have the worst anxiety because I never felt he was interested in making it happen with usIf I could give Dr Copperman and his amazing team 100 stars, it would not be enough . I had not been lucky enough to switch to Dr Copperman, I might have given up and not have had the most perfect baby boy . I had been recommended to RMA by my doctor and others originally, but at the time they did not accept my insurance . I will definitely recommend him to everyone . I went for a consultation and I liked the dr I met, she was very kind and thorough (Dr Allison Styne) . On the way back, I felt horrible, but it didn't affect the results thank goodness!! . They DO NOT care about their patients, they only care about $$$$ . I feel frustrated a year later after going through all this, but I've come out an expert and will not be taking any more fertility meds which seem to cause stress to my thyroid Miscarriage after miscarriage is so upsetting You will find a very caring attention to detail at every interaction Dr Stein and Dr Bar-Chama are the doctors that other doctors use for themselves and their family The Dr took us through the whole process, did an ultrasound, made it all sound super easy and hopeful We felt totally duped . I saw my actual Dr at consultation and one other time when he was doing the rounds . The Dr actually explains your situation comprehensively during consultation She is reachable by EMAIL and she, the Dr, responds! Some doctors are okay, but overall it's not a personal experience and you feel more like a number than a patienthow can I think about the wild range of reviews other than:(1) you love RMA if you got pregnant with a healthy baby (on the first try), or(2) you didn't?we are grateful every time we look at our rock star 3-year old, and are fully aware that Dr Flisser is to thank for him . It is a true group practice, where you see many drs and you are communicating more with the nurses than the Dr during treatment . IVF is a confusing and overwhelming process I always felt I was in good hands here We loved working with Dr Mukherjee! Talk about being treated like just another number!!! Dr Dicken is amazing, as are Dr T & Dr Wang! Dr Dicken sat with us for over an hour in the initial consultation and revamped my medication regiment to focus on egg quality rather than quantity . When you're going through the process, you get to know all the doctors depending on what day you need to come in, and there wasn't anyone I met who I didn't like . But Dr Copperman was my doctor and made what can be a difficult, emotional process so much easier . Then I went to the office for my appt and they'd lost the fax again! After more conversation they then found it again . Then when I spoke with someone she told me that any sperm I donated that day couldn't be used for the egg/surrogate because I needed a physical first, which they couldn't do that daytl:dr: This place has decent doctors but terrible communication and awful staff The stress the latter two cause is enough to keep you from getting pregnant Yes, Dr Klein is pretty good, but the whole experience is terrible No one ever really answered my questions enough to where I felt comfortable going forward5 Stars! I My husband and I both went through a lot of tests . Dr Sandler and his team discussed the issues I was dealing with  . He met with me a few times before we started the treatment  . were my cheerleaders and my voice of reason Today I am 8 weeks pregnant with twins! . I could not possibly recommend a doctor more than I recommend Dr Sandler and his team . Me and my little family are graduating from RMA and I can honestly say, I do not want to leave! Never going back We've since found much more caring and attentive practices and now prefer seeing a doctor who actually will care for you! Difficult as it is to find these days, the effort is worth it Dr Grunfeld was fantastic! Whilst we ended up falling pregnant naturally anyway (one month away from starting treatments!) RMA never recommended that I speak to a therapist or seek any kind of emotional counseling, despite the complicated situation involved with receiving donated eggs . He explained things clearly to me, was proactive, and was reassuring without making any false promises . The fact that he personally answers your emails and in an extremely timely manner is something that is very unheard of in this field When you go to a Dr as frequently as you do for fertility treatment, you really get to know all the players I would actually look forward to going to see them! and focuses on getting you pregnant rather than stuffed with kale and celery . If you are trying to get pregnant I highly recommend RMA of NY .

Reviews: Even through the COVID-19 pandemic, the offices were able to stay open and went to great lengths to ensure every visit was as safe and sanitary as possible Dr Sandler is a great person and, while I was anxious about everything, he made the energy of the whole process more bright and fun Thanks Dr Sandler and team!!!! I worked with Dr Flisser and his assistants Courtney and Ariel, and all of three of them were exceptional Anyone who has been through this knows how organizationally complex it can be, and Flisser's team were on top of everything  I am now 25 weeks pregnant with a baby girl due July 2020 There were many tears and feelings of depression that this would never happen for us If you are reading this review, I wish I had known about this place much sooner Good luck to all of you  hang in there! I hope it works out for all of you Absolutely loved Clara, his nurse, she was really my link btw the doctor and me, if I wanted to try something new, she always brought it up to Dr Grunfeld You go in for a consultation were upon the physician promises you the world acts so positive and sucks you in to vortex of costly treatments Im surprised no one has ever called them out on their abusive practices or how they havent been exposed for the scam they are  We plan to use RMA when we try for a second child in the futureother times they were notno talking, no explanation of what they were looking for, just clicking on the screen and taking measurements I asked questions, asked them to show me what we were looking atI wrote an email and came in to the office to talk about my frustration For such a significant financial investment, I was frustrated that our wishes had been disregarded because it wasn't the "typical protocol" We hadn't been consulted before this decision was made and I'm still disappointed that this occurredI had 19 eggs under treatment, and was initially excited What she was able to tell us in one short session simplified and focused the process It may be important for your team to be aware that intramuscular injections at the top of the bum are no longer allowed in Australia, even for doctor's to administer in this area, due to it's proximity to the sciatic nerve This was in my opinion, bad practice (perhaps you might want to reconsider having patients stick themselves in this risky location) The Doctors are very good with qualified nurses ready to help any time you call  We are now pregnant and just discharged today!  Very happy customers  We had access to a nutritionist and a counselor  They truly are the #1 place for fertility issues and I trusted them implicitly He is definitely worth the visit I can not thank them enough We are so glad we were recommended and chose Dr Lekovich I hope somebody has the guts to file a lawsuit, they should be closed down! is more important than you might think - especially when you're bloated, tired, and have sore veins   Can't imagine a way to have improved this experience Have never had a better start-to-finish doctor visit than this Which is what we were asking them to do, so I can't really be upset, but it would have been nice if they insisted he see a specialist to figure out what was going on with his health Anyway, we love our perfect baby and hope to return again when the time is right Furthermore, they were low-pressure and allowed me to explore as many options as I was comfortable with while helping me ground my decisions in statistics personalized to my situation He is the reason we have our 2 beautiful girls!The only complaint that I had was that they use SS#'s to verify patients UNLESS you ask for a temporary number to replace your SS# I asked for a Temporary # and it was fine thereafter Good luck if you decide to go with RMA! I left the office relieved and confident that I am receiving the very best treatment THANK YOU for restoring my faith in the medical communityBeing a physician, I am disappointed and abhorred how these doctors believe they are treating patients If I had practiced the same, I would have no patients I am truly, truly upsetFertility struggles, I've learned, are one of the most stressful experiences to have to endure They talked to me a lot about getting ready to have twins because, you know, this was going to get me sooo pregnant After that visit, I was never able to talk to a doctor again I just kept saying, I need to talk to someone, get some information, more medical advice or some follow-up That alarmed me since I had so one to talk to about treatments and was finding a lot of info that I had questions about Questions but no one to answer them  I wish you the best of luck wherever you decide to go! I never felt pressured to do anything I did not want to do I did not pursue further testing and shortly after my thyroid got to normal levels I was able to get pregnant and stay pregnant  His straight to the point style was definitely appreciatedI highly recommend Reproductive Medicine Associates of New York I had an appointment with her on April 17, 2019 Yes, he refused to see me saying he was too busy WOW!!! Extremely disappointed with his professionalism  But I will try to provide a holistic perspective of my experience there also - hopefully it might help others going through the process  I also like that at RMA, the process now is for your doctor to do the transfer rather than any doctor who is on duty  No question was too small or sillyDr Flisser is the best of the best  He is always three steps ahead  He truly makes every single patient feel like his priority--a feat, considering what must be an incredibly busy and demanding schedule  Thank you Dr Flisser, Ariel, and RMA NY Eastside  Keep up the awesome work!SHE NEVER CALLS BACK I was at work fighting back tears and got so depressed  I'm going there tomorrow, and I pray that they work better than RMA"  There was no further explanation, nor did I receive any call from the doctor or any subsequent follow upAt this point I knew that regardless of the disappointing results, clearly RMA was not the right practice for me  As such, I called to request my medical records to be transferred to another fertility treatment center (CCRM)   At the time, I spoke to someone in your records department who asked why we were not continuing my treatment at RMA   We heard nothing further from RMA in this regard   Shame on all of youAfter finalizing the cryo preserve issue I thought the RMA nightmare was over I could not be more thankful for his patience and guidance throughout the process  When I tried to call billing and ask for questions, the staff were clueless and had an attitude  Especially beware of Hiura, the information she gave me was grossly incorrect  Furthermore her attitude was off putting  It's a shame because the Doctor's at RMA are top notch, the rest of the staff are below standard  My new Dr Laughed at his notes and apologized for the time wasted there  They are interested in stats not helping you grow a family  I have been on this scary fertility roller coaster for about three years now  If that doesn't say a lot about this man, I don't know what does They are ALWAYS available, and truly on this ride with you  The day I walked into RMA is among the luckiest of my life Didn't push IVF right away since we had no known issue but instead tried other methods first that were less invasive  I also recall looking up their numbers (successful rate) in the national database, and they looked good compare to others Klein in subsequent visits, and he had always been very caring and he takes initiative in asking if I had any questions  They only see you as a cash cow!! GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!If you are Hashimotos or low thyroid, you must be your own advocate My TSH ideally would be below 2 That said, had I known to call off cycle, the office  would have - but since I'm going to experts, it would have been nice if they had been proactive and called off the cycle I know you get excited, but if you have to defer a cycle, just do it Patience is everythingThe doctors here are some of the best and you will note the many times each has been noted for their excellence by the many awards for Top Doctors of the year Most of all, these doctors get you the results you seek without seeming to just raid your insurance and/or wallet Since he had a vasectomy from a previous marriage we needed to get around a roadblock, as it were  We were probably there for 2 hours Since we didn't have 25k lying around, and RMA kept adding charges to our total that weren't told to us up front (despite repeatedly asking what our end total would be so we could plan), we put off the process for about 3 months while we tried to figure out what to do If RMA had done their due diligence we would have saved time and stress and heartache of thinking we couldn't afford to even try  The Dr never explained anything except the obvious and of course if you are new to the process how would you know what questions to ask  RMA is basically a corporation that just wants money  I would never recommend them and I advise everyone to carefully do their due diligence, even if a trusted Dr recommends them YOU MUST BE KIDDING ME !!!! YOU HAVE NO FREAKING DOCTORS !!! I literally see 7 listed on your business card !! Good luck to everyone out there still looking for an answer  He spent plenty of time going over all of our questions, concerns and options at every turn Looks like they were just looking to make money off of unsuspecting patients Meeting with the doctor wasn't helpful either as she just ended up repeating the same information She thought is was one thing then another Bottom line- there was no sense of communication here We found a great IVF doc through Cornell and sticking with himI am a patient of Dr Sandler She is very rude and condescending I am new to fertility treatments When I asked questions or for her to explain the next step she gave me attitude as if this is something I should already know Which, is just incompetentI've gone to six infertility institutions 3 times false information in a row and charged $2,000 on my credit card without my consent which was ridiculous And also, his skill is very doubtful I had worst 2 week-recovery time after he conducted my retrieval STAY AWAY FROM THIS WAY OVER VALUED PLACEVery impersonal I've heard that for IVF they take things more seriously as the other preliminary treatments Wish this nightmare will be over soon Thanks to them I have 2 beautiful healthy babies And if I ever wanted to speak directly with the dr, I did  I truly believe I would not have babies right now had it not been for him and his expertise  It is important to be your own advocate in all medical decisions but it is also extremely important to go to the BEST DOCTORS, KNOW AND FEEL that you are in the best possible hands and TRUST them Was on upper east side but I went to Soho office for daily monitoring When we wanted the dr They are not touchy feely, but I didn't care about that as long as they knew what they were doing That's why 4 starsSimply put- it is more a business than an authentic medical association  Do your due diligence before seeking care at RMA The star is really minus a star) Therefore, stay away from storing specimens at Gramercy IVF We HIGHLY recommend Sher above all else!!! Don't walk away from RMA, RUN AWAY!!!!  GO TO CORNELL MUCH BETTER!!!"  I was pregnant within 10 weeks of my first appointment  It wasn't a particularly touchy-feely experience, but I wasn't looking for touchy-feely, I was looking to get pregnant  I'm now in my second trimester and wouldn't hesitate to return if and when I decide to have more children  Because I'm leaving for South America soon, where Zika is present, I wanted to get this done soon They said I needed a referral from my doctor and blood tests for infectious diseases  I had these done and my doctor faxed over the documents Called them back and they said they didn't have them  I asked them to look harder  So I contacted another facility (with better reviews than this one) and they told me that donors need to have no sexual activity for no less than two days and no more than five for the best donation I think the ladies at the front desk disliked me because I asked questions the first time I was in I'm glad I didn't She didn't explain half the stuff that was listed in this guide they give you, and she was so disorganized and scatterbrained It's hard to even get someone on the phone to talk about it He was very patient in answering questions and very approachableWould definitely recommend this organization! Please find another practice that values patient care over dollar signs I am very disappointed by this officeI would never return to RMA despite the fact they they have great physicians This is not the right place for you if you want to see the same doctor each visit They have done this 1 million times and this is why they have the success that they doI went here last week for a consultation and it was truly  an awful experienceare u kidding me?? A fight erupted Provided no info at all But if u care abut ur self and want the best care that u deserve then go elsewhere I would recommend Dr Sandler and his team to anyone thinking about reproduction assistance  There are numerous other places, I should have done more research in advance He met with me and heard my questions, and was patient with my low-impact approach That was a really bad momentAfter a brief experience at RMA, I decided that their practice was not for me and gladly found the care I was looking for elsewhere after two months of making payments! Literally I decided to switch Fertility doctors  After a recommendation from my friend and then another random recommendation from my mother's coworker  I met with Dr Sandler in January I had a lot of questions and needed a lot of reassurance  Angela, the women who handles all of the meds is an absolute savior Dr Bar Chama is a quack We requested our medical records from the practice because we wanted someone closer to our home in Long Island to follow our care We declined to pay saying that at that point there was no need for the records, we had to repeat several tests and they had been woefully inadequate in responding to our original request The next thing we get is a collections notice All you are is a person with a dollar sign attached and they will find ways to maximize whatever money they can get out of you Stay away from this practice They see a lot of patients and move fast as they are a busy place, so have your questions prepared in advance and you will do well  Their "one size fits all" approach to fertility patients probably cost me a pregnancy  And after I miscarried twice with donor eggs, I simply couldn't believe the response:  "it's probably the adenomyosis you have I have found that every woman is pushed through the same process, given the same advice and has the same plan, regardless of the fact that many of us are there in the first place because we have serious medical issues that demand attention But after my last miscarriage (my second), my doctor simply said, "Well, this happens and we have no reason to worry, so we'll have you talk to the nurse and we can start again" No sympathy, no humanity, and worse, no thought, for a moment, that maybe we should change the way we're doing things instead of plowing aheadI wish that there were other options out there for women Unfortunately, I want a baby so badly that I will probably continue to subject myself to this Nurses and doctors alike just want to get you in and out The doctors who see you when you come in for monitoring are just rushing to get to the next patient, so they offer little to no information unless you ask a million questions and even then, will try very hard to palm you off on the nurse if they can They can't handle the patients they have now  I have read complaints about his bedside manner but I found the opposite to be true I was scheduled to go to Cornell and she strongly suggested I just call Dr Klein and see if he had any availability The next day, they were able to see me, which is so important if you know how timely fertility treatment is From the moment that I first met Dr Klein, he put my mind at ease and was so patient with my long list of questions and concerns There was never a moment that I felt rushed or that I was asking too many questions Cheryl, Lissandra, Audrey, and Raquel became so special to me over the months with the highs and lows that fertility treatment brings Walking through such an emotional, physical, and financial process is really difficult I recommend them to anyone who will listen to meI understand why people would write negative reviews because it really isn't a place where you get your hand held But after over a year of ttc and learning every possible treatment available for my condition (PCOS), I no longer needed my hand held Yes, if you are JUST finding out about your infertility and want a place where you can cry it out after a failed attempt (believe me, I've been there) - this won't be the perfect place"   First of all, I am a doctor and I am quite certain and am very familiar with dosing instructions  Then I am told after the fact that I shouldv'e injected last night and then told it was MY "misinterpretation" that screwed up the schedule  Amber was also amazing  Fingers crossedThe doctors might have good reputations  I stopped going backI have NO stars to give this doctor office "Oh sorry it was our mistake" is what I was told Completely ignoring me as if they were a clerk in a supermarket  I had to ask multiple times to be checked out while each young woman tried passing me on to the next Never even acknowledging the sensitivity of why I and other patience are there When I kindly asked for a supervisor I was asked what do you mean a supervisor? We don't have a supervisor Just awful! And to get your medical records forwarded Forget about itit's a struggle and disheartening experience I don't think the office workers realize that they are there to help PATIENTS not customers Nor do I read reviews

Reviews: Our IVF coordinator, Kiran, was so incredible and compassionate! She was able to answer all of our questions usually within hours of emailing her, and stay current throughout our journeyRMA has been absolutely amazing Vivian, his nurse, as well as all the other nurses I interacted with were kind, compassionate and caring  The initial consult was very thorough and then as you go through the process, your day to day contact is a coordinatorYour nurses and coordinators are a mixed group Sometimes the answers were rude and dismissive We have a 9-month-old now after a very very difficult process--but RMA was as helpful and caring as they could be under the circumstances IVF can be a scary time but they always answered all of my (MANY) questions and walked me through each step of the process in great detail Dr Sandler and his nurses always answer all of our questions and they always follow up after every visit with next steps and results if any Communication is lackingAfter my first visit, I only spoke to nurses ON THE PHONE Every time I went in for a test, she would call me later in the day to tell me the results and then send me an email with the results If I called her for anything, she always answered my questions The nurses were also Every single phone call of mine was returned promptly by the nurses the same day that I called, even on the weekends . Coordinator or nurse returned my calls every time I asked, emails were answered promptly as well He also returned calls on evening and weekends when needed .
