I posted an entire story on my instagram throughout the course of the process if you want to check it out! @jenniferwinkelried She is knowledgable, caring and thorough There will always be someone to take care of you over the phone, email or their online portal, hence you will always be in the loop with your treatments, medication usages/dosages, lab results, billing questions etc! Dr Levine is not only great about calling you but you can reach him via email! He is extremely responsive to e-mails, phone calls, etc

Reviews: Kind, patient, and accommodating staff that handles the logistics with precisionPristine well appointed officesI have been extremely pleased with CCRM Dr Knopman and all the staff, from the nurses to the front desk to the behind the scenes embryology team have not only provided me with top notch medical care, but they have done so with compassion The nurses (and I mean all of them, as there are different kinds) were always there with hugs and words of support when I needed it I am 9 weeks pregnant and moving on to be followed by an obstetrician and I am going to miss them all so much! (Take a pad and pen with you for notes!)I appreciated her thorough approach especially when it led to a discovery of a small growth in my pituitary And I am happy to report we are well into a healthy pregnancy (fingers crossed)! I can't say enough about the staff, who was so prompt answering our many many questionsI can't say enough about the stellar service I received at CCRM NY from the front desk the nurses and the every so important Doctors ( the amazing Dr Talebian was my doctor) right down to the billing department this is a team who love what they do and it showsWe feel like it was a true blessing to have started working with CCRM  After several failed IVF attempts at another clinic we traveled across the country based on a recommendation to work with CCRM NYC CCRM is incredibly efficient and very helpful Even though we were not living locally, we experienced the excellent communication from the entire staff and amazing support from Dr Levine himselfI am beyond happy CCRM is now in NYC! I don't know where to beginI was a patient at CCRM for over a year) The practice is new to NYC and B I was sold on him, the amazing office and the reputation of CCRM being affiliated with the CO office Quite literally, just never got in contact with me ever again when I was waiting to hear back about next steps Financially, my husband and I are still struggling to pay the 30K + in credit card bills we have left from CCRM He replied that same evening and added his Assistant, Stephanie so she could coordinate a time for us to speak the following day It's disgusting and so upsetting- especially after everything that I have been through with the struggle of infertility and the financial implications that come along with it They clearly know that I am no longer a viable IVF patient (their money-maker) In my experience, CCRM's main concern is money, not their patients  I have found a new practice (that I so far love by the way) They don't mess up bills, forget to prescribe drugs I need (like CCRM did for me twice) and my new doctor cares about me- not just taking my money  I had previously tried 2 other clinics and both felt like a factory But it was a whole different story with CCRM staff and Dr Knopman Their spa-like waiting room with snacks, relaxing music, coffee and tea provided such a comforting feeling during a very stressful time for me I never felt rushed or like a number as I did at other clinics Having a tight work schedule myself, I appreciated the fact that CCRM always took me in on time; that rarely happens in other practicesExcellent patient care is CCRM's top priority Lab work and scans can be scheduled very early in the morning which worked out perfect for me since I had to be at work by 8 am All the nurses knew me and were kept informed as to where I was in the process  For me, CCRM defines competency, compassion, professionalism, efficiency & courtesy He took what had been a terrible, chaotic, anxiety-inducing experience and turned it into a structured, calm, and unexpectedly FUN experience I remember receiving a call from him at 8pm, 2 minutes after I had e-mailed, when he was clearly in the middle of a family dinner They were so friendly and wonderful and reassuring, whether drawing blood, demonstrating how best to inject my Ovidrel trigger shot, or calling me to make sure I knew the next steps When I found out I was pregnant, everyone at CCRM was so genuinely happy for me, and I got so many different forms of congratulations5 stars is not enough for CCRM-NY After a previous experience at NYU, ccrm was a breath of fresh air AND TO THE AMAZING NURSING STAFF OF CCRM! Truly an integral part of the amazing care we had at CCRM  Specifically,  I worked most with Liz, Elana and Melissa;  but they all were outstanding nurses They really began to feel like family Their entire staff including the front desk and nurses are phenomenal The practice also has state of the art technology and you are getting the best care on that front tooDr Levine and the staff at CCRM are hands-down the best clinic in New York City  (and I am limiting myself to NYC because I have yet to venture out of the city for any treatments!) We were treated with love and respect at every visit and each appointment was timely and accommodating CCRM is on the cutting edge and a completely different experience My friend insisted that the place really has to make me feel good and at ease, if I was going to choose it for this procedure Needless to say, I walked into CCRM in August and didn't check out any other hospital after that visitThe staff is AMAZING!!!! From the front desk, to the nurses, to the business office and of course the Doctors! Everyone, and I mean everyone was sooo professional, kind, patient, helpful and positive The atmosphere is very tranquil and makes you feel at home I got 24 and I was monitored the entire process You must commit to going and getting blood work and ultrasound almost everyday or every other dayCCRM NY is absolutely fantastic -- excellent doctors, wonderful staff (including the embryology/lab team, nurses, administrative staff, everyone), a pristine lab, pleasant offices Working with them was an all around wonderful experience I had had a horrible previous egg-freezing experience with a different doctor and then came here, and it was night and day different -- and better, with CCRM I highly recommend CCRM NY  The first step was to get some bloodwork doneall the usual clinics  To my amazement they had just opened an office in NYCI don't even know where to begin with this review because there aren't enough good things to say about Dr Levine and the entire CCRM-NY team We were treated with love and warmth at every single visit, making it even harder to leave when our treatment was upI had really high hopes for this clinic, having read so many enthusiastic reviews and gotten references from friends  I waited over 30 minutes to meet with the doctor, who was curt, a little vague on why certain tests were needed but very decisive that the elective procedure was a must, and quick to shuttle me off to the start of at least 5 staff members I would meet during my time there  The only bright spot was one of the nurses - she was kind and empathetic, probably the only person who recognized that this was a voluntary visit  And, you don't have to sign on the dotted line That she is a graduate of Harvard and Columbia (where she also did her one of her two residencies, the other being at Cornell) would surprise no oneBut that's the "easy" part of what she does: the technical aspect of her professionTrying to have a child when you're over 40 isn't easy I love you all Between Dr Choi, the staff, the nurses, and the facility - they are all exceptionalAfter years of struggling with fertility and unsuccessful attempts at several other fertility clinics, I finally decided to travel out of town all the way to New York in order to start fresh at CCRM! As the other reviewers have already stated, there are not enough words to describe Dr Levine and ALL the staff at CCRM Everyone from the front desk receptionists, admin in the back office, phlebotomists, nurses, billing admin and doctors are the most caring, friendly, knowledgeable professionals you'll ever meet They treat you as if you are their only patient! Everyone at CCRM knows you by name and appointments are a breeze to schedule You rarely have to wait past your scheduled appointment time It's the same thing with the nurses I was especially thankful, going into this long distance The nurses emailed me all the necessary documents, sent prescriptions to my pharmacy out of town and just made the whole process as easy as possible! Speaking from my experiences at other clinics, all of the mentioned above is RARE This is the place to go! While doing research for another IVF clinic that didn't feel like a cattle call, I happened to find Dr Choi again, but this time she was heading up CCRM in NY I had heard that CCRM in Colorado was the best fertility clinic in the country and I was pleased to see that it was now in NYC as well I can not stress this enough It is a beautiful facility -- clean, welcoming, friendly front desk staff and calm, especially during a time that can be highly emotional and stressfulIf you are looking for a place to do IVF, THIS IS THE PLACE TO GO!!!!!! I can not say enough great things about Dr Choi, the other doctors here, the nurses and this clinic! Being a patient at CCRM was a whole new game From the lovely receptionists who greet you by name, to the amazing nurses who are always available to you, the staff at CCRM could not be more accommodating  There is not enough room here for me to sing CCRM's praises!!! I am due in September with my second daughter!!My experience at CCRM was wonderful Beyond the incredible staff and care, the space itself is brand new and beautiful -- feels like a spa, which helps add a calmness to the whole situation When we first came to CCRM, we were frustrated, scared, and confused I cannot recommend CCRM enough, their personalized approach not only makes an uncomfortable process more enjoyable, but also provides amazing resultsI can't speak highly enough of CCRM The entire team from receptionists to nurses to the team of doctors and business support were highly attentive & personalCCRM NY is amazing! Everyone from the front desk staff to all of the doctors far exceeded my expectations The facility itself is state of the art and super cleanDr Levine has been absolutely wonderful to work with (he's kind, funny, patient and wise beyond his years, he remembers very detail and always makes time for me when I need to ask him something, I feel safe under his care and blessed to have found him), as is Amanda in billing (helpful and full of knowledge, answering my endless questions and helping me understand both insurance and self-pay matters to figure out what's best for me), Plus all of the nurses (especially Ali who has been supportive and nurturing like a sister), and the receptionists (Stephanie's/Kate who brighten up the phone lines and office) It is a beautiful modern and clean space too White glove service without a doubt I actually went to NYU first for a consult- it was a disaster I felt like cattle and was totally ignored by all the support staff there despite the doctor seeming very good there too but all the rest of the staff gave me so much anxiety At CCRM it is a different and far better world, they humanize and personalize every moment Each person at CCRM - from the doctors to the nurses to the technicians to the staff - is absolutely incredible  You feel a part of the CCRM family immediately and the individualized attention they give each of their patients is unparalleledI first used another fertility clinic in NYC, but when I heard that CCRM was opening an office here, I switched immediately  And the nurses at CCRMwhere do I begin?!  They make you feel warm and welcome, even though you are scared and nervous  They ALL remember your name and are extremely efficient with bloodwork  Even the receptionist is welcomingI cannot say enough great things about CCRM new York I had spent too much time  with another practice that felt like a factory with a great deal of frustration before I found CCRM  Aside from their impressive credentials and top notch lab, their empathy and genuine care was amazing I can't say enough good things about him and his team--I met many of the other doctors, nurses and techs, and they were all phenomenal This place stands out above all the others that I researched Thank you CCRM!These group of physicians have the best success ratio, professional, personalized and compassionate in making our dreams come true It would not surprise me if he was thinking about every single patient outside of his office hours I would implore him to run workshops all over the world to teach doctors how to provide care like his My biggest piece of advice would be to run, don't walk, to CCRM tomorrow morning (and yes, you can likely get an appointment for tomorrow!!), and don't even think about seeing any other doctor or clinic
summary: Kind, patient, and accommodating staff that handles the logistics with precisionPristine well appointed officesI have been extremely pleased with CCRM Dr Knopman and all the staff, from the nurses to the front desk to the behind the scenes embryology team have not only provided me with top notch medical care, but they have done so with compassion The nurses (and I mean all of them, as there are different kinds) were always there with hugs and words of support when I needed it I am 9 weeks pregnant and moving on to be followed by an obstetrician and I am going to miss them all so much! ( Take a pad and pen with you for notes!)I appreciated her thorough approach especially when it led to a discovery of a small growth in my pituitary And I am happy to report we are well into a healthy pregnancy (fingers crossed)! Truly an integral part of the amazing care we had at CCRM . I worked most with Liz, Elana and Melissa; . The first step was to get some bloodwork doneall the usual clinics . The only bright spot was one of the nurses - she was kind and empathetic, probably the only person who recognized that this was a voluntary visit . Speaking from my experiences at other clinics, all of the mentioned above is RARE This is the place to go! While doing research for another IVF clinic that didn't feel like a cattle call, I happened to find Dr Choi again, but this time she was heading up CCRM in NY I had heard that CCRM in Colorado was the best fertility clinic in the country and I was pleased to see that it was now in NYC as well I can not stress this enough It is a beautiful facility -- clean, welcoming, friendly front desk staff and calm, especially during a time that can be highly emotional and stressfulIf you are looking for a place to do IVF, THIS IS THE PLACE TO GO!!!!!! I can not say enough great things about Dr Choi, the other doctors here, the nurses and this clinic! And the nurses at CCRMwhere do I begin?! . They make you feel warm and welcome, even though you are scared and nervous . They ALL remember your name and are extremely efficient with bloodwork . Even the receptionist is welcomingI cannot say enough great things about CCRM new York I had spent too much time . and don't even think about seeing any other doctor or clinic

Reviews: Because it was our first time seeing a RE, he started with a very thorough diagnosis procedure and recommended that we attempt IUI first, explaining to us the success rate of this procedure compared to the slightly more invasive IVF procedure After a few IUI attempts that were not working for us, he recommended that we move on to IVF, which we did, ultimately achieving success on our first embryo transfer As I developed thyroid issues early in my pregnancy he recommended a great list of endocrinologists that I could choose from, based on my health insurance coverage and preference I won't get too much into what happened specifically with my IVF's because in both cycles, my embryos were abnormal After my 2 failed IVF's Dr Levine suggested I try taking Clomid and either doing timed intercourse or an IUI Their approach is extraordinaryMost importantly I got pregnant with the first IVF Cycle I left my first appointment with a clear plan: we would start as non-invasively as possible, with a timed intercourse cycle (including Letrazole and an Ovidrel trigger shot, to maximize our chances) Over the next four months, my husband and I did three cycles of timed intercourse and then ramped up to an IUI at Dr Levine's suggestion Our first IUI was successful, and I am now 4 months pregnant with a baby girl!I was obviously thrilled with the outcome We were successful in our first ivf cycle at ccrm and are now 18 weeks pregnant After our first meeting, we were sure we were moving forward with our second IVF cycle and we couldn't have been happier from day one The process was made so easy, and I completed the cycle last week This is what makes them special; they cater the hormones based on your levels so if you're getting too much based on how your labs come back- they will either lower or increase your dose We now are 14 weeks pregnant, with additional healthy tested embryos preserved When I went to do IVF last year, she was no longer there I froze eggs in nov and going back to do another round next month What started off as consultation regarding ovulation ended up in a 9 month journey and a successful IVF transfer  He takes the time to recommend treatment that is specific to your case, and not just a textbook protocol It's been months and I bet he can remember the minutia and every single detail of my treatment and care
summary: He takes the time to recommend treatment that is specific to your case, and not just a textbook protocol It's been months and I bet he can remember the minutia and every single detail of my treatment and care

Reviews: It's pricey, no doubt about it, but if you can swing it you'll be glad you did But the team (especially Stephanie) helped us understand costs and commitments upfront, always with patience, and even helped navigate billing with our insurance  *5 star rating is not enough*The DeSimones What I do have a problem with is that after two failed IVF cycles that I paid completely out of pocket for (my insurance covered NOTHING), they have GHOSTED me This is very special in the world of egg freezing Sometimes, it all works out; sometimes, it doesn't It may be a little more expensive than Columbia but WELL worth it Our experience with them includes both an IVF freezing cycle as well as an ovulation induction and IUI cycle They're worth every penny!
summary: It's pricey, no doubt about it, but if you can swing it you'll be glad you did But the team (especially Stephanie) helped us understand costs and commitments upfront, always with patience, and even helped navigate billing with our insurance . *5 star rating is not enough*The DeSimones What I do have a problem with is that after two failed IVF cycles that I paid completely out of pocket for (my insurance covered NOTHING), they have GHOSTED me This is very special in the world of egg freezing Sometimes, it all works out; sometimes, it doesn't It may be a little more expensive than Columbia but WELL worth it Our experience with them includes both an IVF freezing cycle as well as an ovulation induction and IUI cycle They're worth every penny!

Reviews: Empty
summary: Empty

Reviews: My husband and I have been trying to have baby for many years We had amazing experience with Dr Dicken and staffs at Sher Institute They were very professional and because of them, we finally have our baby girl! They really need to bone up on bedside manner and respectful treatment of womenI can't begin to explain how amazing my experience with DrT and his entire staff at Sher has been! I have a beautiful 2 year old son and am currently 6 months pregnant! Dr T and the staff at Sher are kind, patient, accommodating and at this point I consider them an extension of my family They take their time, actually listen and answer every question ( very late emails as well!) I can't recommend them enough- and I do to anyone going through this process! I could go on and on!!!! The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the dreadful billing department out of Las Vegas Each time I have these encounters I say to myself how much I "hate this place" and then I'm reminded of the care I receive from Dr Dicken and her patient coordinator Jacqueline Piccardo Some times I've had to reschedule meetings and another time Dr Dicken accommodated me despite the ridiculous appointment given for 8amThe two stars are what is left of my terrible experience with this clinic, if not for the responsive and attentive care that I receive from Dr Dicken and Jacqueline Piccardo I would give 0 stars (if possible)  I have never heard of anything like this  I don't think I can recommend this place to any of my friends that are looking to find out some information on fertility options to be left feeling cheated Anyhow I got a beautiful baby boy from Dr Wang and I am forever grateful to him and his team - the Dr are not reliableCan't say enough good things about Dr Dicken and the staff at Sher Dr Dicken is warm, caring, and super smart -- she's been willing to work with us through several failed IUIs, and now a successful IVF cycle Highly recommended!Dr T made it possible for me to get pregnantAfter two previously failed IVF treatments by two different RE I chose to go to Dr T because he looks into immune issues He never orders unnecessary tests and always reviews all of your records thoroughly before your initial consult You have 24/7 access to Dr T and trust me, he is the most patient human being out there! He will nonstop respond to all of my emails no matter what time of the day I send them He is so prompt with responses to email, and for a nervous person like me this is ideal Dr T will be the only doctor on top of your treatment, making up your treatment schedule, doing all of your monitoring and all of your procedures I cannot say enough good things about Dr T I was so scared about never being able to get pregnant again and Dr T made it happen for me on his first cycle T, I thank you from the bottom of my heart for being such a compassionate and caring doctor, for being such a smart and caring doctor, and most importantly, for being the miracle worker that you are!UPDATE #1: I now have a beautiful 4 month old baby thanks to Dr T! And I'll be going back to him next week to work towards baby #2!Update #2: thanks to DrT I am 6 months pregnant with baby#2 I am sorry for the other patients who suffered as a result of their poor management I suffered 2 miscarriages as a result of their negligent practices This Institue took a year of my life and all I received in return was an "I'm sorry" Dr Dicken was always responsive to emails within hours, even on the weekends When you create your treatment plan, you sit down with person who does billing And I know that the process to the end result can be stressful and painful I'm really surprised by the one-star reviews on here and had the complete opposite experience, so I wanted to express how highly I recommend Dr Dicken and the team at Sher  Fertility struggles are always difficult, and you may not get the results you hope for, but the team at Sher made the whole experience as pleasant as possible for me, and I successfully conceived my baby girl via IVF with Dr Dicken  I saw Dr Dicken at every appointment and she always took the time to answer my questions and discuss next steps  Five stars for the team at Sher- I'm already excited to get back in the office to meet with Dr Dicken and plan for my next baby! I like Dr Dicken and the patient coordinator, Jacqueline Dr Dicken is quite knowledgeable and has this girl next door appeal that completely puts one at ease Patient care receives four stars It was very obvious that the staff below the Dr level were not getting the support they needed I understand that Thanksgiving is a holiday, but in most cases the Dr is in charge of managing your cycle, so they could prevent this via closer management or better staffing And that's what Dr O'Shaughnessy doing (It took) Sher is a nightmare I said is there a balance on the accountI'm cuddling with my baby thanks to the efforts of the staff at Sher- especially Dr Wang and Raifa Zody, the embryologist Dr Wang is personable, explains everything fully, and even emails! I was never just a number  I saw a doctor at LIJ first, and would leave in tears after how he treated us Dr Wang was the complete opposite They made me feel comfortable and was very positive with the process I was about to start I saw Dr Tortoriello, He listened to me and gave me options that I could choose from based​ on my situation Dr T is an absolutely perfect, kind and humble person My baby is almost one year old Dr T was quick to reply my emails even on Sunday I hope that they replace her with someone nice Dr Dicken, a staff doctor, seemed nice, but was also clueless for a "specialist" Her suggested, cookie-cutter protocol wouldn't have worked for us Because of my uterus condition, I was told to give up getting pregnant by many doctors at NYU and CHR After two years of trying, my husband and I almost gave up to have a baby, but we wanted to try once more at Sher with Dr Tortoriello, and miracle happened!! AMAZING!! I got pregnant Different protocol and medications worked, and also, Dr Tortoriello was very kind and cared about his patients very much I am at 11 weeks of my pregnancy and still have long way to go, but I am very happy and appreciate Sher and Dr TortorielloAfter 5 long years trying to get pregnant  Dr Tortoriello was successful with me on a first try  I was told the truth by Dr T from the beginning  He gives the raw facts whether you want to hear it or not Dr O'Shaughnessy was thorough, patient and kind throughout the entire process I saw the same doctor at almost every visit (unless it was a weekend or she was on vacation) Dr O'Shaughnessy even came in on her weekend off to do my egg retrieval I now have a beautiful seven month old son, which I conceived by going to Cornell I went to NYU and Cornell and both doctors told me that they do not see any reason that the fibroids are causing infertility I am the same person with the same eggs and same husband and the same fibroids After I was devastated the second time it did not work, I emailed Dr Dicken, she responded with one line and repeated that I need to have surgery to remove my fibroids I then called to talk to her and she never called me back This is to say just to say how much he cared I am forever grateful to him Sher Institute gives me nightmaresI loved working with Dr Dicken She was patient, kind, and always available to answer all of my questions We went through a process of trial and error figuring out which treatment was best for me and ultimately I got pregnant My daughter was born a couple of weeks ago and I'm so grateful to have found Dr Dicken Fertility treatment can be stressful but I always felt like I was in good hands with Sher and I recommend them to anyone in a similar situationThe review below took the words out of my mouth  Every time I had to have surgery I cried on the table- not because I was scared, it was because everyone was so callous and cold  Dr Dicken will sit with you for however long you want to listen to your concerns and questions  She is caring, down to earth and smart They care, smile at you and know you by name!  I cannot put into words how amazing it feels to be at a place where everyone is genuinely nice and cares about youLastly, their surgery center is really niceIt is my honor to write this review on Dr Tortoriello (Dr T), who treated me with great knowledge and professional care We are joyful in my pregnancy the birth of our daughter this October and we are really glad to be treated by Dr T My husband and I were ready to give up after 3 years over thereAfter two months on the waiting list, we got our appointment with Dr T My first appointment with Dr Dicken went well, and I decided to continue my treatments with her I have never received a well formulated answer from her for the reasons of my multiple failures (I do get pregnant easily though, but always miscarry) My husband and I had a wonderful experience with everyone there and highly recommend this practiceDr O is a kind and warm person with an appropriate level of firmness and humor in her approach She explained things thoroughly and always assured that I was comfortable with each step It's taken me years to write this review because it was such a horrendous experience I was told later by multiple Doctors that the fertility Dr should never have taken my money because I could not hold a pregnancy with my fibroids In the end, I had my fibroids removed and got pregnant with New Hope FertilityLet me start off by saying I love my doctor, Dr Althea O'Shaughnessy she has been great through the process already and that is why I am giving a 4 star rating Because of the way my cycle fell I had to make an appt for Monday morning They couldn't confirm me when I called Friday but told me I would get a call Sunday  I don't know what the deal is because they have called me about other matters  I just don't care enough to do it  I did not feel like I was well taken care of  Appointments felt rushed, Dr Tortoriello who was my doctor didn't ask if I had any questions-ever-, and didn't really connect on a human level a whole lot  IVF is a tough process to go through, and I was hoping for a more pleasant, cared for, connected experience  Bushra, the nurse, who showed me how to use the injections buzzed through the instructions like she had to be elsewhere, I felt so rushed and felt like such a number not a human  I had to email the doctor and he said, no one talked to you after?  No  No one was there to see me out, to give me some instructions, I left feeling very confused and hoped that someone would contact me later She is warm and professional and her expertise helped us conceive our little miracle I highly recommend Sher and specifically under Dr O'Shaughnessy for any and all fertility needs  She has a great bedside manner and does not try to apply cookie cutter protocols I am grateful to have her help me through this journey and I would highly recommend her for IVF and fertility issuesDr Tortoriello does not really try to find a cause why you are infertile New Hope was a winner for me giving me my precious baby girl from the first try You need to chase down the phone line to get a simple straight answerDr Wang is very nice and that is the sole reason I decided to try there After 5 years of fertility treatments, my husband and I welcomed our daughter into the world on 2/7/18 Although it did take some time for us to find the protocols and treatments that ultimately worked (I have a fairly complicated medical history), I was continually amazed by the dedication Dr Dicken exhibited toward my case She was there at every turn -- from recommending different tests and treatment options along the way to returning panicked emails promptly to lending a compassionate ear when I needed it most Highly, highly recommendDr Dickens is an angel!!! I have been ttc for five years I'm now PREGNANT =-)  :) Dr Dicken was on maternity leave for the first IUI, so Dr T performed the 1st one and Dr Wang did my second IUI, both were great!!!! Dr Dicken is amazing, as are Dr T & Dr Wang! Dr Dicken sat with us for over an hour in the initial consultation and revamped my medication regiment to focus on egg quality rather than quantity  The doctors and nurses are all so warm & make you feel so comfortable I can't say I was a very complicated case, but even so, my husband and I were always treated as if we were the only patients there I never waited for more than 10-15 min to be seen by my dr And, when you have an appt (which you will have a lot of!) you will see YOUR dr I saw Dr T for each and every appt (except when I had to go in on one Sunday and he wasn't on call that weekend) I can't explain how comforting it is to know you are seeing the same dr during such an emotional processI only have positive things to say Not only is he intelligent, but also kind, extremely calm (which is something I needed!), and honest (he tells you how it is, so don't expect sugar coating) You will not feel like 'just another patient'  He actually cares and will thoroughly go over your history and make sure he treats you appropriately And, the best part - he was successful with us on our first IVF cycle! I can't recommend Sher and Dr T and his team enoughDr Wang is the BEST--he's gotten me successfully pregnant twiceAfter seeing other IVF specialists in the city and being told I would likely not have children with my own eggs, I decided to do some more research about who else could help me I was given Sher Institutes name from a friend and calling them was the best decision ever Not only did they help me get pregnant, but they made the difficult process so much easier  Dr Dicken was the most caring, empathetic and approachable doctor I've seen Dr Tortoriello understood our situation and decided to make it count Unlike our previous experience  in which we felt we were being treated like cattle, over at the Sher institute we felt like everyone there knew our situation and were there to help us make it happen  However, when I approached Dr T to explain this (a problem with signaling from my pituitary that only started when I was 20 yrs old), he had a plan in mind for my treatment and it worked! Throughout the process Dr T was so calm, positive and reassuring It took three rounds of treatment with IUI and I now have a beautiful healthy baby boy thanks to Dr T and his team! Dr Tortoriello is aces! The RE before him was recommending surrogacy or adoption When I went to see Dr Tortoriello I immediately felt that I could trust him He is one of the most balanced, caring and intelligent doctors I have ever had You really feel like he is plugged into your case You know that feeling, when you are sitting across from a doctor and he is giving you these canned answers, like he is reading from a script or has said this to so many people that he is bored of hearing it himself? Dr T is the exact opposite of that He is a real person When you get off the elevator the receptionists greet you by your first name (the opposite of making you feel like a number, which I felt so many times at other facilities) I have only ever heard them say good things about this facility and Dr T
summary: My husband and I have been trying to have baby for many years We had amazing experience with Dr Dicken and staffs at Sher Institute They were very professional and because of them, we finally have our baby girl! I have a beautiful 2 year old son and am currently 6 months pregnant! I can't recommend them enough- and I do to anyone going through this process! I saw Dr Dicken at every appointment and she always took the time to answer my questions and discuss next steps . Dr Tortoriello was successful with me on a first try . I was told the truth by Dr T from the beginning . Every time I had to have surgery I cried on the table- not because I was scared, it was because everyone was so callous and cold . Dr Dicken will sit with you for however long you want to listen to your concerns and questions . She is caring, down to earth and smart They care, smile at you and know you by name! . Bushra, the nurse, who showed me how to use the injections buzzed through the instructions like she had to be elsewhere, I felt so rushed and felt like such a number not a human . I had to email the doctor and he said, no one talked to you after? . Dr Dicken is amazing, as are Dr T & Dr Wang! Dr Dicken sat with us for over an hour in the initial consultation and revamped my medication regiment to focus on egg quality rather than quantity . you will see YOUR dr I saw Dr T for each and every appt (except when I had to go in on one Sunday and he wasn't on call that weekend) I can't explain how comforting it is to know you are seeing the same dr during such an emotional processI only have positive things to say Not only is he intelligent, but also kind, extremely calm (which is something I needed!), He actually cares and will thoroughly go over your history and make sure he treats you appropriately And, the best part - he was successful with us on our first IVF cycle! I can't recommend Sher and Dr T and his team enoughDr Wang is the BEST--he's gotten me successfully pregnant twiceAfter seeing other IVF specialists in the city and being told I would likely not have children with my own eggs, I decided to do some more research about who else could help me I was given Sher Institutes name from a friend and calling them was the best decision ever Not only did they help me get pregnant, but they made the difficult process so much easier . in which we felt we were being treated like cattle, over at the Sher institute we felt like everyone there knew our situation and were there to help us make it happen . Throughout the process Dr T was so calm, positive and reassuring It took three rounds of treatment with IUI and I now have a beautiful healthy baby boy thanks to Dr T and his team!

Reviews: The doctors also go on their own vacations for weeks at a time which can really interfere with your treatment Are you serious???!!! I didn't even ask for my scheduled time I just suggested I was there to see Dr Dicken I SWEAR I would think it was just me if I had not read the other reviews Well the damn specimen would've died by then I was out of hope and trust in SIRM and desperate for results After going through 6 cycles of IVF, yes you read that right 6 cycles, I only wish I switched to Cornell sooner and saved myself a lot of heartache and despair I hardly ever check YELP I wish you ladies all the best and pray for you all to be successful in your journeyplease reach out and pm me if you have any specific questions or want to talk Best wishes to allI am not sure if I trust this place as they have a ridiculous appointment policy  They took my $50 deposit for just making a call to schedule an appointment  First thing they asked when I called to schedule an appointment was my credit card information - $50 copay and $150 for cancelation fee  I can't really comment on the doctors here but don't think I can trust a place that's so money focused and only in it for profit  This is very dishearteningI was Dr Wang pt- him and his team were excellent It is such a pity to know he is no longer there I am not sure how a lump sum of 4k can get misplaced in the system with no record, but apparently at SHER it does Them comes to anesthesiologist which SHER hires for your procedures and it is SHER whom receives the payment I am traumatized by this practice They just care about the money  You are a number with a $ value no more I think they don't want you to be pregnant as they will make more money if you aren't We haven't been anywhere else and I wouldn't want to -- the level of professionalism, service, and friendliness is just right The only issue has been with the finance team -- they do not provide details invoices and very casually ask for a lot of money, without back-up documentation I can look overlook that, though, with the quality of care and service I've received He never pushes anything and always thinks outside of the box After meeting with me he did an immune workup and found that I have elevated NK activity He is always very receptive and caring The process was perfect and went so smoothly, we couldn't ask for a better outcome My spouse and I Love you from the bottom of our hearts for helping us create the family we once thought we would never have i went to the Westchester office which closed down while under treatment Since my doctor was fired and the office was closed about a week before my scheduled transfer,  I had to seek another doctor I find this  Institute to be unethical at its core My one piece of advice to potential patients is keep researching There has got to be better out there After our first attempt failed I went to Cornell, NYU and RMA for second opinions and also to find out how they proceed with  their protocols and maybe they would come up with new way of treatments for me Well, RMA had a very complicated payment options Very shady practice So I figured I will go back to Sher since I know how they operate You can basically choose what you want and/or need to do The most important thing, of course, is that I have my baby Fortunately my credit card company found the charges suspicious and contacted me right away And when I contacted the office manager Jessica about it she ignored my emails So be warned, if you can avoid it, pay by check instead25 stars if that were possible Also, for the record, I got pregnant at SHER, so I am not bitter I think it is awful to dismiss other reviews for this reason They admitted to me that the operator was less experienced and that they were understaffed because of Thanksgiving As a patient we go through an awful lot to get a viable egg I have since found out that not only is this not true but that if an egg is genetically determined to be a good egg, a woman in her 40s is almost as likely to get pregnant as a woman in her 20sI hate doctors do whatever tests or extra stuffs without asking the patients to make some extra money Like they think patients don't know anything I wasn't there for any pregnancy issues, and I made myself clear to the doctor why I am there After the short consultation with the doctor, they did the blood test So I obviously thought it was for my health issue I never asked for it or knew the blood test was for that For something I never asked for I am not only very mad about this rip-off situation, but also worried about the time that I will waste to make this thing correct Wish me good luckThe two stars are because I have a beautiful daughter that wouldn't have been possible without the help of IVF That said I know we would have had the same luck with any clinic Their scheduling system was a joke So I went in for the following visit and was asked to pay more money They didn't even care to check or notice Completely clueless They completely take advantage of the vulnerability in people who just want to be parents I've never had doctors fight so hard for me before It was amazing to be able to discuss questions and concerns with my actual doctor outside of appointmentsIf you look at Vitals or one of the websites that's known for rating doctors, rather than restaurants, you'll see that Sher has phenomenal reviews, which they've very much earned I am super excited, and I am recommending Sher Institute to anyone struggling to have a baby He is simply the best I do not need medical advice from front desk woman I was so disappointed that I tried timed intercourse and it worked SHER knew this and recommended a protocol, which I followed to a T Not only would it not have worked, but they aborted a procedure MID-TREATMENT (yes, during the procedure itself), because an independently contractor doctor was impatient, running late, and in a hurry This wasted my whole cycle Treatments were chosen based on their findings and now we have our son Thank you so much!!  I had done several yrs of acupuncture, herbs and nothing before I came to Sher  They also wanted 50,000 for their donor egg program  That was the only way i opened up tp other possibilitesI should have written this a long time ago I had fibroids and Sher doctors were insisting that I have to have a surgery I realize that medical opinions may vary among experts, but insisting so much that someone goes through surgery without backing up your claim is something else When I switched to Cornell, I realized that much higher standards exist The doctor even changed the dosage of the meds after each visit sometimes changing them a tiny bit here and there At Sher, they rarely changed the dosage and they were less meticulous about timing, weekly tests, etc So 1/1 at Cornell and 0/3 at Sher I advise you to stay away I wasted more that a year at Sher with no results and I am so sorry about it Mostly because my dad died and I would have wanted him to meet my son I am also really unhappy with their manners At Cornell, my doctor called me on a Sunday afternoon before my transfer (while walking his own kid to a birthday party)  No one listened to me, looked me in the eyes or cared  I was 1 of a million other patients  I was passed around between 7 or so doctors  Sher and Dr Dicken and her staff are *complete* opposites  She does not sugarcoat anything and is straight with you  She is just a really good person  Plus, one of the best parts is that you can email her your questions and she replies promptly)If you are starting your fertility journey, please start with Sher The meeting with the primary doctor was usually very cold and brief and I could feel that she was exhausted and was ready to dismiss me as fast as possible But we finally made up minds to search for another doctor and take the last IVF chance And all those online reviews are telling the consistent story He is the person I can trust He is not a magic maker but he is the best possible doctor you could work with as a man He won't give up if you don't but he also gives you alterative options and make sure that you are comfortable with your choices I believe his biggest goal is to make women fulfill their dreams of becoming a mother And with that goal, he stands out from his peers I had to be very proactive and be involved in every single step and know every single detail to make sure that I am being treated properlyI wish I had found Sher first Every piece of advice from the Sher team was perfect, especially their urologist recommendation, Dr David Kaufman Thanks to Dr O and the whole team at Sher we are expecting our first child, and I truly believe that this would not have happened if we stayed at the other clinicRun don't walk away from this place Even trying to get my medical records was gigantic ordeal Please don't waste your time and money with SHER Never happened and it slipped my mind to follow up Thank goodness I did, my appt was for 8:30 am No one ever came back and I had to climb down Also make sure you get a copy of EVERYTHING you sign Would give no stars but that is not an option But I DO have two pieces of advice1 - Ask questions  Ask more questions  Sher likes to email forms instead of handing them to you in the office  When you see these forms in your email, you might have questions, or the forms might be incomplete  Go ahead and email your questions back  There is a lot of paperwork  Let me say that again  I have never, not once, ever received a call telling me my appointment time  I learned to call between 4 and 5pm to confirm my appointment time  Seriously, if you havent heard anything from Sher about your upcoming appointment time by 4:45 - pick up your phone AND CALL!My partner and I had a really substandard experience with this officeWe have nothing bad to say about the doctor, only everything and everyone around herAs you may imagine we were unsuccessful in our attempts to get pregnant We wish you better luckI just want to say, I am not the kind of person who writes negative reviews  But this is worth writing  There was no followup from the doctor, not one word  I am exceptionally disappointed that I chose SHER and I will let everyone I know about my experienceDr O is simply the best She made a very stressful process with high emotions something that was optimistic and manageable She thinks outside the box and will go the extra mile I was not impressed as I was looking for much thorough doctors since we were young and healthy couple trying to conceive after already unsuccessful IVF I went to Cornell thinking they are the best, but we were again not blessed with the baby Imagine you have daily appointments at the end of the cycle And BTW, it is not surprising that they don't call you back as promisedI truly cannot thank Dr Dicken and the staff of SIRM enough for their hard work and support I literally just cleared my tubes two weeks ago and I found out I was pregnant today!!!! She is an awesome person! I'm soooooo glad I sought her help! She's not just about money, she REALLY CARED!!! She's the best Dr I've EVER had With her advice) Therefore, stay away from storing specimens at Gramercy IVF We HIGHLY recommend Sher above all else!!! Thank you SHER!!!!!!!Sher Fertility and Dr T are the absolute best There are so many options but please trust me and make an appt with Dr Texactly what you are looking for in a Doctor You will be in good hands! I wish I had known of them sooner!My condition was highly unusual, they don't have a name form to as it is very rare I had the sinking sense that he was just trying to get rid of me because I had a complicated fertility profile and he didn't want to mess up his excellent success rates Over the last six years I have met a lot of women struggling with IF Some women gush about him I am eternally grateful to him not just for getting me pregnant but for creating an atmosphere in which I could relax and trust which I believe helped me be successful
summary: The doctors also go on their own vacations for weeks at a time which can really interfere with your treatment Are you serious???!!! They took my $50 deposit for just making a call to schedule an appointment . First thing they asked when I called to schedule an appointment was my credit card information - $50 copay and $150 for cancelation fee . I had to seek another doctor I find this . They also wanted 50,000 for their donor egg program . No one listened to me, looked me in the eyes or cared . Sher and Dr Dicken and her staff are *complete* opposites . Sher likes to email forms instead of handing them to you in the office . There was no followup from the doctor, not one word . She's not just about money, she REALLY CARED!!! She's the best Dr I've EVER had With her advice) Therefore, stay away from storing specimens at Gramercy IVF We HIGHLY recommend Sher above all else!!! I wish I had known of them sooner!My condition was highly unusual, they don't have a name form to as it is very rare I had the sinking sense that he was just trying to get rid of me because I had a complicated fertility profile and he didn't want to mess up his excellent success rates Over the last six years I have met a lot of women struggling with IF Some women gush about him I am eternally grateful to him not just for getting me pregnant but for creating an atmosphere in which I could relax and trust which I believe helped me be successful

Reviews: She's very responsive on email and answers all of my questions, big and small, quickly and thoroughly Jackie and the nursing team have been fantastic, even responding to a panicked email late at night when I was having trouble with a trigger shot  I always had personalized attention at Sher from Dr Dicken and nurses Marian and Jackie and they always responded to me timely It was as if I sent her nothing - absolutely no response The problem here is that the nurse practitioners are made to double up as administrative co-ordinators, a nurse should support the medical process and a co-ordinator should guide you through the process Rest of the staff was wonderful specially the nurse Jackie P She answered emails quickly (and I sent lots) My experience here was fantastic I emailed her back with a couple questions and she never replied back Unclear and erroneous information (often errors in medication and instructions, no clarity about billing; 23 page invoice and unable/unwilling to answer questions about it) He is also very responsive via email (replied within couple of hours), which was super helpful for a nervous wreck like me He answers emails
summary: She's very responsive on email and answers all of my questions, big and small, quickly and thoroughly Jackie and the nursing team have been fantastic, even responding to a panicked email late at night when I was having trouble with a trigger shot .

Reviews: I had a very disturbing experience with one of their doctor and nurse teams I would not recommend this place to anyone Their contact is rude, and short fused and hasn't called me back for months- until today!If you are looking for a fertility clinic please look no further- they made this process as beautiful as can beJust keep every record of payment and take a deep breath before you call their billing department in Las VegasHorrible experience Also I received a test that was out of network without being told and was billed $4,412! They have one method of doing IVF and even though I requested a new method I was never given one Do yourself a favor and go to a clinic that has better lab quality and will work harder for youI should have written this review a while ago when I had my first experience with the rude receptionist (I think she practices being her rudest everyday), and ridiculous scheduling system Regarding the consistently rude receptionist, the one with the glasses who sits on the side closest to the elevator - she never smiles, is unkind, demonstrates a consistent inability to help or accommodate and is consistently MATTER-of-FACT You would think the front desk staff would be a the softest, kindest spot in the clinic Regarding scheduling, I've had several scheduling incidents where they call me at the end of the day to provide an appointment time for the next day despite the preferred times offered I get to the front desk, the rude receptionist goes on to tell me with the snide look on her face that she doesn't have me on the schedule for 8, she has me on there for 8:30 The simple response would have been okay, but instead she had to let me know that I'm the schedule for 8:30 I can't understand how a fertility clinic can be so inefficientThe last straw is this specimen that I was told I could bring in at 8am and this same rude, unsympathetic reception insists that no one is available until after 8:30 Right now I FUCKING HATE THIS PLACE, as I sit in the reception area crying with a specimen that I'm certain may no longer be viableTrying to conceive when having challenges is already stressful and depressing and the additional challenges I experience with front desk staff and scheduling just makes this entire experience overwhelmingly sad When I asked why I wasn't informed that the biopsy was no longer usable I received the reply "people don't usually wait that long" To be specific, I waited 3 years to do the PGD because I thankfully had a successful cycle at Cornell For any of the reviews that say Cornell is like a factory, so many women go there because the care is world class Yet despite the high patient volume, I still felt more professionalism, kindness, and 'general ease' as a patient, then I ever felt at SIRM And for all the ladies that reached out to me with similar traumatic experiences at SIRM, I'm sorry I didn't respond to you in a timely manner  I called a few hours later to cancel my appointment and was told that they will be charging me $50 But this review is only about SHER: the billing was a disaster- when you are going through infertility, everything feels harder so you expect at least the fertility center makes it easier for youDespite of all these, we had to confirm and reconfirm the payments over and over: every couple of weeks would get an email saying " you can not start your treatment unless you pay your balance"! Hence making calls and someone didn't know about the payment and then again and again! I think in a course if two months we confirmed the payments three times Now just waiting for my ultrasound He listens and most importantly this is like a boutique clinic where it is all about you  The office itself is so mismanaged Mistakes on med calendars, overlooking pertinent details, last minute delays in protocol were all common practice in my experienceIt's hard to give reviews to a place like that Meanwhile, the girl who seem to be like 18 years old in the billing department couldn't tell me what the percentage was or how much money I would get back They are very good at keeping track with your protocol and followups With That said, I didn't have to be on top of things all the time, because I was pretty sure that they do it for me None of the other places I've been to have such system This was very helpful for us They also made it very easy with prescriptions, I was looking for the cheapest places to find my drugs, and they would forward and re forward prescriptions for me to different pharmacies pretty quickly The nurses are also pretty cool, I've never had anyone being rude or unprofessional But honestly, I pretty much had a stress free experienceI've been waiting to write my review until after I delivered my beautiful healthy baby girl, which I did a couple of weeks ago  Sher differentiates itself because you really do get personal treatment and you do not feel like just a number, as tends to happen with the other large IVF clinics  Appointments were easy to schedule in the morning before work, and the team of receptionists and nurses all knew me personally and made everything super easy   This was a huge contrast to the other IVF clinics in NYC, where the receptionists were disorganized and didn't answer the phone half the time I would call  I think your experience with any of these clinics likely depends on how you like to work with your medical team- I'm always needing to be in control and need someone who will answer my calls and emails on time, and that's what I got at Sher that I didn't get elsewhere My experience was excellent and successful, and my beautiful healthy baby girl is a testament to thatThe staff are great Be wary of billing and never provide your credit card information lest you desire to pay for things that you did not authorize I authorized a payment of $2,000, and a couple of days later there were a few charges to restaurants and Pro Flowers The only place I used this card was at SIRMI have thought long and hard about writing this review, but I feel like other people who are about to start the ivf journey should absolutely be aware of the issues I experienced The first, but perhaps not the biggest, problem is that clinic is extremely disorganized When you find out that they have ordered the wrong medication (occasionally at great expense) on the day that you are supposed to be starting treatment, the stress that is added to the entire experience is exponential, because then it is up to you to run around town to find a specialty pharmacy that has the meds in stock, some of which are further constrained by national shortages Having now experienced a clinic where the co-ordinators support the nurses, it is a far more effective system and creates a much more supportive culture Every time something went wrong, which was pretty much weekly, no one took responsibility, never mind that no one apologized and the next time I went in everyone looked more and more terrified and harried, but because taking responsibility was for some reason impossible, it meant that no one would offer to help fix the problem This was because they were were understaffed and using a less experienced sonogram operator We started with 11 and ended up with 3, so losing 1 through carelessness is pretty epic Perhaps because if we had determined that more eggs were not viable they would not have been able to charge us for as many transfers and they would have made less money?My advice is to find a clinic that has not been bought as a commercial enterprise and is not run as a business I booked this place because I had some emergency issue about my health and it was the only place was available near my work Because this institute system is really slow and not organized The receptionists are rude and never pick up the phone The staff is rude and unhelpful The thing that gets me most upset is the lack organization with their billing What kinda response is that?! Then I was told the overcharge would be kept on file for future chargesThen I received a check in the mail with an arbitrary amount as a "refund" for being overcharged The numbers didn't even match No notification that things were changing just a bill saying we owe them more money for something we set up a monthly autopay forEvery staff I met at Sher from the first visit was very welcoming, friendly and made me feel comfortable TI worked for me Lady on the front desk is rudeRUN like your pants are on fire!!! Stunningly unprofessional After several failed attempts at another clinic, I found out I had immune issues Then, they sent me outrageous bills for he procedure that never happened! You can't make this stuff up When I moved to another clinic, they were willing and able to work with an immunology clinic in CA, where I shipped my blood regularly  I feel he was competent and I never had to worryHe knows what he's doing I would never go to another doctorI came to Sher after a frustrating experience at another "monster" clinic, the kind that makes you feel like a number and not a patient My first experience at Sher was completely different She is a compassionate provider and up on the latest techniquesThe staff at Sher is informative and supportive Jessica, the office manager, took a good hour to go through the financial options The front desk staff were responsive and the nursing staff were consistently kind and personable If you are looking for a fertility clinic I strongly recommend you interview them They were pretty sloppy The staff at Sher always made me feel at home which is helpful when it feels like you live there! They always had appointments first thing in the morning and I was often in and out within 15 minutesI was also at another clinic before this one  They treated me and all the other patients as farm animals The nurses are also exceptional  Not only is the staff remarkable, but from an operational aspect, Sher also kick-a** I have never had a scheduling issue and the staff in charge of insurance matters is extremely informative, competent and easy to work with  You have an individual room to recover!  (At my other clinic you recovered right next to the other women who had surgery, with the only divider being a sheet  This is an emotionally taxing enough endeavor- do yourself a favor and start with a clinic that cares about you We had really hard time attending the other factory-like clinic--dealing with multiple doctors, waiting in long lines and facing with a big stack of bills He is compassionate and objective at the same timeI came to SIRM after a frustrating experience at another clinic I was very happy to find out that she communicates via email which is something that in this day and age all doctors should be doing I had previously been to another clinic where I felt like part of a herd being shuffled in and out with no personalized careSher was the total opposite, from Yochana at the front desk to the office manager Jessica; but most importantly Dr O'Shaughnessy and her team All of the nurses and clinical staff were great too, especially Voula who went absolutely above and beyond when we ran into a hiccup in our cycle I would give it negative stars if I could  The doctor and nurses gave me such bad and insufficient information and wouldn't take any responsibility for it  They are the worst HOWEVER, I have to agree with the other reviewers about the office staff and the rudeness and lack of follow up So I arrived for 8 am just in case I had an early appt like requested When I called to make my next appointment, the receptionist asked me when I would like to come in I said first available please, "Ma'am what time do you want to come in?" The tone was so rude, I replied "8 am or 8:30?" Again she didn't give me a time just told me they would call and confirm the time If you can't give me a time and you know your first available appointment is at 8 am why ask me for a specific time?!??! Like I said I keep going back for my doctor and my nurse, Annie Chan, but the rest of the staff be warnedBy far the worst experience I have had with a doctor's office The Manhattan location is the rudest by far After a procedure I was told they would be back in 10 minutes to help me down from the table Be mindful of billing I had fraudulent charges for check fees on dates where checks were never sent The Westchester location had a staff member attempt to put my signature on an insurance form When I showed up at the Manhattan location they tried to get me to resign the form that had the fraudulent signature I will never go back to this office againI don't have anything bad to say about this place People in the office have been really helpful  Its okay to do this2 - No matter what they tell you, never wait for them to call you with an appointment time  For those who don't know, SHER doesnt have 'cattle calls' like many other clinics do  Instead, they assign appointment times the afternoon before the day you're supposed to go in to the office  In therory they will call you by 5pm and tell you what time to be in the office the next day  I even totally missed an appointment this way because I waited, and no one called Miscommunication with the lab caused a months' delay and the office staff was untruthful about this until pressed Scheduling with wrong doctors, wrong medications indicated on treatment schedule, incorrect information on dosing caused lost time at work to find alternative sourcesWe are not medical experts, but the constant stream  of small errors gave us little confidence in the process or the personnel  This was absolutely a horrible way to treat a patient who paid good money for this procedure and now who is walking out the door having had the transfer only to feel like they were 'done' with me  The nurse who called me to give me the bad news said he would follow up, and probably take another blood test etc  but they have ostensibly dropped all further 'care' now that they have my money The doctor's office is run like a well-oiled machine, but with good bedside manner Office hours are the most flexible I've ever seen, I never had to wait more than a minute upon arrival to be seen, often I'd even arrive early and would be out before my scheduled appointment time The office staff were also incredibly helpful and caringDrDicken is my favorite doctor at SIRM NYCThis facility is not closed, however, I had the WORST experience with it just like the first reviewer I recommend you to run away from this place Some of the staff are really rude Among the worst is its office manager ironically   Make sure you read the financial plans line by line You need to book each monitoring appointments with the front desk even though the monitoring is routine and preset  After you make the appointment, you need to wait for the front desk to call you for appointment confirmation until the day before However, I didn't expect to have to deal with so many incompetent staff which could jeopardize the result of an entire cycle Before working with the team at Sher we had been to two other clinics in 3 years and had subpar experiences at both The nurses and office staff here are also top notch She insisted I have another done this time with canalization Even though it was a short period of time The doctors answer your emails even on the weekends and in the evenings!!  The front staff are great too We had such a bad experience at RMA All the receptionists and nurses came to know us by name and were genuinely always happy to help Also, the new offices are beautiful! If you are unsure of which clinic in NYC to choose, this next part is for you Sher is not a factory like the other clinics (ie Cornell, RMA) I was actually nervous while in the waiting room before my first appt because there weren't hundreds of women waiting But I've later realized it's because they actually go by appts and honor the appts; you will not be 1 of 10 patients scheduled at 2pm Not just a nurse or whoever is there that day You will have his attention for as long as you need; he never rushed me out She empowered me to help make decisions while providing excellent guidance and expertise She provided so much calmness to me and I couldn't have done it without herWe came to the Sher institute after failed attempts at Cornell and Columbia clinics We couldn't be happier with Dr T and his staff, and can't wait to see our little baby boy in a few more months Throughout the procedure all the staff was very helpful and responsive to our schedule and concerns and we can't be more grateful for their great service Definitely, the best fertility clinic out there Just wish we had gone there in the first place He took my preferences into account and was always flexible with appointments regarding my work schedule After six years of dealing with, seemingly intractable, infertility and going to five of the most reputable clinics on both the east coast and west coasts, I am now 12 weeks pregnant He doesn't make huge promises (read: sales pitches) but he is more focused on his patients and designing custom protocols for them than any of the other seven doctors I have seen at those five top facilities The previous poster is in California so perhaps she is confusing this facility with another one This is the most responsive and caring group of medical professionals I have EVER experiencedThis office is not closed but is absolutely TERRIBLE in their communication Medically they are OK but they are rude, unhelpful, and treat you like just another #
summary: I had a very disturbing experience with one of their doctor and nurse teams I would not recommend this place to anyone Their contact is rude, and short fused and hasn't called me back for months- until today!If you are looking for a fertility clinic please look no further- they made this process as beautiful as can beJust keep every record of payment and take a deep breath before you call their billing department in Las VegasHorrible experience Also I received a test that was out of network without being told and was billed $4,412! Hence making calls and someone didn't know about the payment and then again and again! I think in a course if two months we confirmed the payments three times Now just waiting for my ultrasound He listens and most importantly this is like a boutique clinic where it is all about you . Sher differentiates itself because you really do get personal treatment and you do not feel like just a number, as tends to happen with the other large IVF clinics . This was a huge contrast to the other IVF clinics in NYC, where the receptionists were disorganized and didn't answer the phone half the time I would call . You can't make this stuff up When I moved to another clinic, they were willing and able to work with an immunology clinic in CA, where I shipped my blood regularly . Not only is the staff remarkable, but from an operational aspect, Sher also kick-a** I have never had a scheduling issue and the staff in charge of insurance matters is extremely informative, competent and easy to work with . You have an individual room to recover! . ( Its okay to do this2 - No matter what they tell you, never wait for them to call you with an appointment time . For those who don't know, SHER doesnt have 'cattle calls' like many other clinics do . In therory they will call you by 5pm and tell you what time to be in the office the next day . of small errors gave us little confidence in the process or the personnel . This was absolutely a horrible way to treat a patient who paid good money for this procedure and now who is walking out the door having had the transfer only to feel like they were 'done' with me . Make sure you read the financial plans line by line You need to book each monitoring appointments with the front desk even though the monitoring is routine and preset .

Reviews: After multiple IUI's and miscarriage, we decided to do IVF After 4 rounds of IUI and 2 IVF with no results I did one IUI with gen next and GOT PREGNANT! There labs are old and can cause many issues within the processI hardly ever YELP but I am doing an update to say that I tried to send out the biopsy of my only surviving embryo at SIRM for PGD after three years of it being frozen and was told by Carey Dicken and the office manager that I no longer had the option to do PGD because the biopsy is now too old Why didn't I use my embryo in the first place you might wonder? Because I was down to the last of my savings and it would've cost almost as much to transfer that embryo at SIRM as it would to do a full donor cycle at Cornell I had 36 eggs retrieved I noticed that 3 days after!!!!! Can you believe that, they gave me expired medication!- I got one of the eggs they retrieved transfered by RMA I was pregnant for 10 weeks I am sure they took the money and didn't test the embryo  Thank to them i am 10 weeks pregnant and I am just waiting to have this fetus dies into my body as it had genetic default!!!!! Can you imagine the trauma - They obviously failed at an other transfer I did with them We did IVF with PGS and on my first attempt I got a BFP You are not another patient in a factor setting like you would be at the big academic institutions (where I got my BFN with a PGS normal embryo) And the best part is that for the transfer he allowed my husband to come into the room with me! He was able to see the transfer and the embryo go into my uterus liveStay far far away I was told by my doctor that I had 2 frozen embryos for my next transfer Which at the day of my transfer we discovered I did not have 2 embryos but a morula and and early stage blast  Both which are unlikely to result in pregnancy  I wonder if I would have stayed with sher if they would have continued to lie to me about the quality of my embryos I had a professional doctor review my embryo results and NONE were considered to be viable for transfer They transferred 2 fresh and froze another 2  In other words, the don't comply with industry standards on viable embryos I've never had an issue with them forgetting to call me and inform me about any changes to my protocol And I have additional frozen embryos from my IVF cycles, which I'll transfer in hopes of bringing my daughter a sibling Another huge problem with this clinic is that for the first embryo transfer they took far too long to transfer the embryo into my body The embryo should not be outside of storage or the body for more than a few seconds, 30 seconds is a long time for this process, and for my first transfer it took a few minutes The final issue I will share with you is that they told me that the genetic sequencing of the embryo is a waste of money The older you get the less good eggs you have I don't know why they missled us? IVF is split into 2 halves, egg retrieval (out of you to be fertilized) and then the fertilized egg is transferred back into you The egg retrieval is reasonably easy, 2 weeks of tiny under the skin injections, but the transfer is far more intense with months of bigger injections into the muscle However, next time I realized they did a genetic test through other company, about if my babies are going to have any genetic issues I was overstimulated and there for had fluid in my uterus (Caused by them) and then was told instead of doing a fresh transfer I should wait a few cycles and do a frozen transfer (which would be another $5000 and the money shouldn't be my deciding factor) I said I believed in my body and why wouldn't we try the transfer because there was a possibility it would work Then was told well actually I'm going to be out of town on your transfer day so was it my body or their convenience I did the fresh transfer with another dr and the fluid was no longer present  They are crooks With his great work, I had a successful IVF procedure I did two IUIs and one timed intercourse with injectable cycle I agree with the negative review on this page She messed up with my IUI timing Then gave me lecture that how my egg will wait for 24 hours after ovulation so they can slide my appointment of IUI Everyone knows that IUI is time critical She also told me that ivf patients are priority for egg retrieval and my egg can waitDrTortoriello made me pregnant!! I had developed Asherman syndrome after I lost my identical twin girls at 17 weeks of my pregnancy, and I had three uterus surgeries to remove my scar tissue I also tried north shore in manhasset and after a surgery, 4 iuis and a failed ivf nothing My first round of IVF ended in a chemical pregnancy after which the doctor came up with a new strategy that made all the difference I did two rounds of unsuccessful IVF (two rounds of retrieval and two rounds of transfers) I had enough eggs and that was not a problem I even scheduled my surgery to remove fibroids but decided to get other opinions I got pregnant with the first attempt at Cornel and with transferring only ONE embryo At Sher, the first round they transferred  one embryo and the second round two embryos He said that he proposes we only transfer one embryo (we had talked about transferring two) and that there are risks associated with carrying twins at my age, etcOh yeah, and it worked We brought home our son the other day and he's healthy and perfect I went to Dr T when I was 38 after many rounds of IUI and two IVF with another clinic My case was not easy for her, and she tried her best to adjust my protocol but that is all she could do I would need to have them removed before in-vitro  Coming to SHER for my IVF was a mistake  After my transfer, I was given NO instructions  Unfortunately, I had a chemical pregnancy and was not able to keep the pregnancy I recently had a hysteroscopy performed by DrDicken and my uterus looks so much better after she removed all of the scar tissue He suggests right away the IVF and assumes various scenarios without any analysis I finally consulted with Dr Dicken and went thru 2 egg retrievals and several transfers at SIRM I had an HSG done and the result was both tubes were blockedSher is the best!!! At the age of 36 and after trying for over a year and a half and after 2 IVFs, 1 FET transfer, & 4 IUIs, we finally discovered Dr Dicken and this clinic On the second IUI, we got a POSITIVE pregnancy result for the first time ever!!!!! I am only 4 weeks pregnant, but all seems to be going well Dr Azim was great BUT the lab that he uses (Gramercy IVF) has freezers that ruined our sperm quality which was excellent quality from a sperm bank This is actually the reason why we ended up having subpar thawed sperm for our first IUI at SHER (b/c it had been stored at Gramercy IVF before being transferred to Sher  I would recommend this group to anyone who has been told what I was, or if you are just starting off on your IVF journey He didn't want to just pump large quantities of drugs and getting a large amount of eggs, but he cared more about getting quality eggs He decided to use a different mixture of drugs that helped us produce quality eggs and he made it count as promised He was resisting doing an embryo transfer even though we had frozen embryos His exact words 'You deserve at least one transfer if not more before going to surrogacy' I got pregnant on my first FET with him He remembers your info when you have an appt with him
summary: After multiple IUI's and miscarriage, we decided to do IVF After 4 rounds of IUI and 2 IVF with no results I did one IUI with gen next and GOT PREGNANT!
