summary: Empty

Reviews: I remember our first visit with Dr Castelbaum I literally was crying in his office when he told me my chances of normal pregnancy was so low Although this was not what my husband and I had planned, everything happens for a reason With Dr Castelbaum's support and guidance, along with a great team; we are 8 weeks and 6 days pregnant  To be able to get pregnant from our first transfer, it's a blessing She was always kind, gentle when taking blood and remembered me by name I am now lucky enough to have a wonderful baby boy after years of trying, including a heartbreaking miscarriage A special thank you to Dr Castlebaum, who is smart and confident and got the job done! Jodi from finance was a huge help Also a huge thank you to Dr Gutman who made me feel like I was her only and most important patient during the implantation I am so thankful that my family is now complete, and I recommend RMA to anyone having trouble with fertilityShe feels the need to belittle her patients by commenting on their socks or their childrenI will never recommend RMA to anyone You're a number to them and never get a call backCastlebaum is absolutely amazing and has a wonderful bedside manner After all the frustation we decided to go the best IVF doctor in town, Dr Freedman at RMA of King of Prussia/Philly At this time we are pregnant and we thank no one else besides Dr Freedman at first the billing is tricky but no worries they are honest and care only about making us happy,, so please choose this place and stop waisting your time at these other places Do not forget we got pregnant within 6 months YAYThey subcontracted our appointment process, took 2 times to have our appointment booked for our first visit, first time they didn't have our record at all Dr Castelbaum is definitely my favorite, but Drs Freedman and Gutman are great too  She gives you direct feedback about you, your health, your partner's health, and your fertility plan  I also saw Dr William Schlaff on occasion when Dr Gutmann was unavailable and he was extremely caring, sensitive, and had great bedside mannerDo not go here!! They only care about the money and your treatment plan will not be personalized They are extremely accessible which has helped immensely during the emotionally and physically taxing experience of IVF I started taking a friend there (who needed some assistance due to language barriers) about 1 The most impersonal experience for such a personal thing To make a long story short, after 2 failed ivf cycles, I found it appalling that once again the doctor couldn't call me himself to deliver the terrible news For such a personal topic, this place makes it so impersonal You don't feel connected or welcome, it feels like they literally just go through the motions Then my hubby convinced me to try one more time so I gave RMA a try My main RE was Dr Guttman I also saw Dr Freedman, Dr Gocial, Dr Kallen, and Dr Schlaff They were wonderful and treated me with respect, while being honest The Jefferson office saw us so much that they would greet us by name and pick up conversations where left off Dr Gutmann is smart, thoughtful, listens well, is unfailingly persevering, and kind
summary: I remember our first visit with Dr Castelbaum I literally was crying in his office when he told me my chances of normal pregnancy was so low Although this was not what my husband and I had planned, everything happens for a reason With Dr Castelbaum's support and guidance, along with a great team; we are 8 weeks and 6 days pregnant . To be able to get pregnant from our first transfer, it's a blessing She was always kind, gentle when taking blood and remembered me by name I am now lucky enough to have a wonderful baby boy after years of trying, including a heartbreaking miscarriage A special thank you to Dr Castlebaum, who is smart and confident and got the job done! She gives you direct feedback about you, your health, your partner's health, and your fertility plan . I also saw Dr William Schlaff on occasion when Dr Gutmann was unavailable and he was extremely caring, sensitive, and had great bedside mannerDo not go here!!

Reviews: Today, was a happy day; unlike the first visit I will fully recommend anyone struggling with infertility to visit RMA of Philadelphia  Dr Gutmann is the worst  She has no bedside manner and always just tells you "looks great" Gutman, on the other hand, can best be described as a twatI would highly suggest avoiding this corporation for fertility care Trust me this place is the Best  We stopped visiting them since  Dr Gutmann was my primary doctor  She was honest, knowledgable, and thorough  After 5 months of office cycles, we were able to conceive naturally and we are now expecting our first child  I would recommend this practice to anyone I switched to another practice and finally got to experience a truly patient centered approach Let me numbers speak for themselves Cooper reproductive: Pregnant 3/7 cycles (3rd is 4m/o baby boy I am holding right now) about roughly 2k in debt (that could be an over exaggeration) Learn from my mistake and don't waste your time or money The highly individualized treatment we have received here is incredible  We would highly recommend RMA to anyone struggling with infertility issues  Again, truly disappointing I should've trusted my instinct, because I had nothing but problems from the beginning But we proceeded anyways The doctor never once called personally to deliver any test results or ask how were doing I could write a book and go on and on about the horrendous experience we had there And sometimes that's not even done properly It absolutely stinks I wanted to transfer 3 but Dr Freedman wasn't having that so I prayed my 2 would stick, since my other 2 didn't make it to the freezer They talked through all of our options (medical, financial, legal) with great patience and detail She's a strong advocate for diverse families and I've heard her voice more than once on NPR as their go-to soundbite If you're reading this you're considering embarking on this possibly long and winding road
summary: Today, was a happy day; unlike the first visit I will fully recommend anyone struggling with infertility to visit RMA of Philadelphia . She has no bedside manner and always just tells you looks great Gutman, on the other hand, can best be described as a twatI would highly suggest avoiding this corporation for fertility care Trust me this place is the Best . She was honest, knowledgable, and thorough . After 5 months of office cycles, we were able to conceive naturally and we are now expecting our first child . I would recommend this practice to anyone I switched to another practice and finally got to experience a truly patient centered approach Let me numbers speak for themselves Cooper reproductive: Pregnant 3/7 cycles (3rd is 4m/o baby boy I am holding right now) about roughly 2k in debt (that could be an over exaggeration) Learn from my mistake and don't waste your time or money The highly individualized treatment we have received here is incredible . We would highly recommend RMA to anyone struggling with infertility issues .

Reviews: In fact, the nurse that called me wasn't the nurse I even normally worked with- some random lady I don't think I've even met
summary: In fact, the nurse that called me wasn't the nurse I even normally worked with- some random lady I don't think I've even met

Reviews: We graduated from RMA Thank you to my favorite nurse Heather My office of choice was in King of PrussiaI am so grateful to all the wonderful staff at RMA King of Prussia and Willow Grove I loved all the nurses, especially Jill from the willow grove locationIf I could give negative stars, I wouldBilling is also the worst She is cold and rude  The doctors are fantastic however this billing department treats you As nothing more than a revenue streamAfter numerous attempts at IVF with places like Abington and Cooper Institute and tons of money spent and a total of 4 years on those places and the place is high class and state of the art, it is worth it Very bad experience with customer serviceI love RMA of Philadelphia I can't say enough about the professionalism, organization and friendliness of everyone on staff I love all the docs Thank you for giving me my pride and joy twice! Love you allWhat a wonderful experience with RMA!  From the minute you step in the door, the entire staff makes you feel welcomed, accepted, and comforted The billing department was very rude and made me realize how money centered they are5 stars does not do RMA justice! We have been beyond satisfied with the care that we have received by the entire RMA team We haven't had a single bad experience with any of the doctors or nursesThank you inviting me to call your office I am still waiting for from a call from the Doctor I have been waiting to hear back since mid-JuneThis place is terrible Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else The nurses were rude, the staff unorganized, a huge mess The only time the doctor called me throughout process was to apologize after one of the nurses yelled (and I mean yelled) at the patient If I could give this place 0 stars, I would I thank my doctors, the nurses, the receptionist and all the administrative staff at the Center City and King of Prussia office for the pleasant experience  In each case the staff was super professional and unfailingly kind Both the Jefferson and KoP offices are clean and comfortable  That's pretty impressive given that appointments are quick and happen super early in the morning
summary: We graduated from RMA Thank you to my favorite nurse Heather My office of choice was in King of PrussiaI am so grateful to all the wonderful staff at RMA King of Prussia and Willow Grove I loved all the nurses, especially Jill from the willow grove locationIf I could give negative stars, I wouldBilling is also the worst She is cold and rude . The doctors are fantastic however this billing department treats you As nothing more than a revenue streamAfter numerous attempts at IVF with places like Abington and Cooper Institute and tons of money spent and a total of 4 years on those places and the place is high class and state of the art, it is worth it Very bad experience with customer serviceI love RMA of Philadelphia I can't say enough about the professionalism, organization and friendliness of everyone on staff I love all the docs Thank you for giving me my pride and joy twice! Love you allWhat a wonderful experience with RMA! . From the minute you step in the door, the entire staff makes you feel welcomed, accepted, and comforted The billing department was very rude and made me realize how money centered they are5 stars does not do RMA justice! In each case the staff was super professional and unfailingly kind Both the Jefferson and KoP offices are clean and comfortable . That's pretty impressive given that appointments are quick and happen super early in the morning

Reviews: I started my IVF journey in January 2019 Although I wasn't excited about the shots , the hormonal pills and the countless visits for bloodwork and ultrasound; but they got the job done and they did it right When I left here/got kicked out at 31 I was told my only option was donor egg/embryo Diagnosed low AMH at age 30 I would definitely not recommend to anyoneAfter suffering a miscarriage last June, I was done with IVF According to statistics, at 35 with poor ovarian reserve, I had a low chance of conceiving, but I did with God's and all the Doctors' help I only ended up with 4 embryos and transferred 2, one of which wasn't close to being a blastocyst We worked with Dr Gutmann on two pregnancies that involved IUI and IVF  I was actually quite shocked and disappointed by the contrast when I finally transferred to my OB After seeing my developing embryo up close for the first few weeks, I couldn't believe that the OB office had so little technology
summary: I started my IVF journey in January 2019 Although I wasn't excited about the shots , the hormonal pills and the countless visits for bloodwork and ultrasound; but they got the job done and they did it right When I left here/got kicked out at 31 I was told my only option was donor egg/embryo Diagnosed low AMH at age 30 I would definitely not recommend to anyoneAfter suffering a miscarriage last June, I was done with IVF According to statistics, at 35 with poor ovarian reserve, I had a low chance of conceiving, but I did with God's and all the Doctors' help I only ended up with 4 embryos and transferred 2, one of which wasn't close to being a blastocyst We worked with Dr Gutmann on two pregnancies that involved IUI and IVF . I was actually quite shocked and disappointed by the contrast when I finally transferred to my OB After seeing my developing embryo up close for the first few weeks, I couldn't believe that the OB office had so little technology

Reviews: I had to tell the billing office they didn't submit 3 claims for my IUIs and when they did bill my insurance, they did not submit my referral so now they are sending me bills After the visit we were sent a bill after 2 month said we have to pay 200 sth even though we took our insurance info, after I disputed they re sent it with $10 copay Plus your plan is dependent on whether or not you have coverage Their success rates are so high because they essentially say they can't help you anymore after 2 unsuccessful ivf attempts if you don't have insurance RMA: pregnant 0/6 cycles (4iui 2ivf) and about 30k in debt

Reviews: We've been seeing Dr Orris as well as Dr GlassnerSo the first review I did was negative because it took forever to get through my first appointment We got an apology from every person we saw on the way out We were seen by DR Glassner who gave us great care and spent a lot of time answering our questions and explaining things to us They definitely made up for the wait! Also, the Dr called a few hours after we left with test resultsDr Glassner was absolutely amazingI went to MLF after not being able to conceive for 4 years At the end of the procedure, Dr Orris took his gloves off and left the room without any words Leading up to this Dr Orris was flipid numerous times when we had questions After this we decided to switch to Dr Glassner I couldn't believe how dismissive they were as well about my experience They knew my history of endometriosis and should have respected that I was accurately describing what I went though We left MLF at that time to seek fertility treatment somewhere I was respected and listened toMy wife and I went through one month at MLF and refuse to ever set foot in their facility again  Dr Glassner lied to my face about the course of action we were taking, and ended up starting an argument between my wife and I because someone was lying and I had no way to ascertain who it was until after workAfter many years of trying to have a child Dr Glassner was my solution  He is genuine, kind, and ultimately concerned about my wellbeingI started my journey with Dr GLASSNOR in November 2017, Myhusband and I got pregnant with twins in March 2018, we unfortunately lost them on Aug 20, 2018, I would definitely recommend dr glassnor and his team in a heartbeat, you feel right at home with them, it's like one happy familyI saw Dr Glassner over the course of 3-4 months I am currently 8 months pregnant with a healthy boy! When we first found out we had fertility issues we were told our chances of conceiving naturally were extremely low (less than 7%) Right from the start Dr Glassner was open and honest with us about our situation We never felt pressured into any treatments or excessive procedures On top of that they are truly compassionate and invest themselves in your situation  The problem is that my wife is a teacher and has to take off of work to go to their consultationUpdate:We are continuing down the path with MLF Literally the words "I promise I'll get you pregnant with IVF" were said and clearly that did not happen Was also told my AMH was a certain level and when tested at another clinic very shortly after, it was much lower The doctor's answer to this was she would give me a discount next time That was a low blow but I understand it's policy I also was permitted to do 7 iuis at $400 a try and never told to stop although research shows we had like an 8% of it working after the third try was unsuccessful Doctors were very nice and seemed to care- just false promises that broke our hearts when it didn't work out and we lost all our savings Dr Orris and Dr Bloom are amazing We were confused due to the many meds that we started and Nikki and Dr Bloom took so much time to explain things to us Dr Orris is so knowledgeable we feel confident this process will result in a beautiful baby for us My partner is an obgyn/ MFM we decided on main line because after researching Dr Orris as well as Dr Bloom we were confident that in the end we'd have a beautiful family  I've gotten a crazy amount of spam calls daily and I am sure it's from this hack as the timeline fitsAmazing practice! Without MLF I would not have my beautiful 6 month old son Joey! Dr Glassner is a great doctor who never gave up on me! Always professional and compassionateI was very impressed by the overall flow of the office, the quiet yet compassionate disposition of the staff, Dr Glassner's forthcoming manner and expidited testing available here I feel like I have finally found thr right place I highly recommend this officeI was lucky enough to work with Dr Glassner, Rachel and Sue He treats everyone as an individual and doesn't apply the same global treatment plan to everyoneMy Husband and I went to Main Line Fertility a few years ago to begin our fertility journey Dr Glassner told us that nothing went wrong it just didn't work As we were both upset we decided to take a break to decrease our stress in trying to conceive A few month ago we started treatment again with a different Fertility Doctor and were initially told that not only do I suffer from PCOS (which we knew from the beginning), but that my Husband's sperm was not where it needs to be to conceive naturally I honestly feel like they took time and money from me and my Husband during this hard time Also, I feel like they truly do not care about individualized services as we were passed around from Dr to Dr during our entire time with them I would not recommend Main Line Fertility to any of my friends or family based on my experienceI would and have recommended Dr Glassner and his CRNP Rachel to family and friends Dr Glassner even took the time to call the day after to check if my husband or I had any questions That 3 minutes out of his day spoke volumes to his care for patients The doctors seem very rushed, and seem like they want to get you out of their office as soon as possible, even if you don't feel comfortable with the treatment plan My doctor doesn't seem to even remember who I am, and I often have to remind him of certain conditions that he forgets I have  MLF has the following going for it: In Philadelphia area, they have the most amount of donors  Unfortunately MLH treats their patients poorly, and why would you want to go through this during such an emotional periodI was a former patient of Dr Glassner's,  and had two successful pregnancies via IVF in 2006 and 2009  Dr Glassner spent approximately five minutes with me during the initial consultation to determine the 'plan' (and I use that term generously)  He was clearly in a rush, and I left the meeting feeling not completely comfortable with the information I"d been given  The specifics of my situation were not taken into consideration by Dr Glassner, simply because he is so busy with so many patients We had issues with him years ago during our initial IVF attempts- he rushed through some of the decisions he needed to make, and prematurely drew a conclusion about our chance of conceiving that turned out to be completely inaccurate I believe that Dr Glassner is most likely talented serving patients who are the 'toughest' cases- the ones he finds especially interesting, unique or challenging Everyone else- coming in with 'unexplained infertility'- may find themselves trying harder to get his attention, or, unfortunately, having their case mishandled by his  lack of attention to detail You need decide how comfortable you feel with this approachI became pregnant with my daughter via IVF with Dr Glassner and the amazing staff at MLF At first I was pregnant with twins and when we lost the one baby (I was by myself) the staff was so caring and gentle Dr Glassner spoke with me right away to ease my fears of a full miscarriageDr Brasile was wonderful  Dr Brasile is energetic and her enthusiasm and positive outlook rubs off on you when you may be at a very frustrating point in your journeyA good friend of mine recommended Main Line Fertility I was a patient of Dr Glassner's starting July 2013Dr Glassner put together a plan of action that he thought was best and would work for me He told me what my challenge was and said to me "I'm not scared of you!", which made me feel confident that he was sure that he could help We are now 28 weeks pregnant and we have Dr Glassner and his team and Main Line Fertility to thank!I've worked met Dr Orris and Brasile, and the P Rachel and they were all amazing Dr Glassner and his staff treated us with such patience and caring, and we couldn't be happier with the entire staff I had 10 failed IUIs at RMA of Philadelphia, then three failed IVFs with Dr El-Roeiy at Crozer, then two failed IVFs at Dr Check's office in Marlton, NJ My dreams turned into a reality when I went to see Dr Orris Dr Orris analyzed my situation thoroughly and took the necessary time and reviewed my thick pile of paperwork/history I brought to himwell let me tell you, PLEASE do not be embarrassed, the only way to learn is talking about infertility! So, two gals told me about Dr Orris, how he help get them pregnant via IUI; he didn't push them into doing the IVF procedure since he thought it wasn't necessary and all they needed was an IUI to get pregnantI was under the care of Dr Glassner for 11 months in 2014  I always felt that I was under exceptional care A Doctor or RN was always available to answer my questions or concerns  On my initial visit, Dr Glassner assured me that I would be able to get pregnant within the year, with some work Dr Glassner was very confident and direct with his plan of action pending my test results Dr Glassner laid out the options for my care and based his recommendations on my family planning goals  After we had 2 failed transfers, we met w Dr Glassner for next steps Dr Glassner and the rest of the staff at MLF are exceptional people  Thank you MLF!  We are so fortunate to have a beautiful baby girl thanks to Dr Glassner and his excellent teamI have been a patient of Dr Glassner's since 2008 when he assisted me and my husband in becoming pregnant with our first son My husband and I were recommended to his practice after trying to become pregnant for a year unsuccessfully The minute Dr Glassner introduced himself and shook our hands, we knew we were in the right place Three successful pregnancies later, we express our gratitude to Dr Glassner and his staff everyday He helped us through each pregnancy and never lost hope They are optimistic and celebrate every positive sign with you I never had a difficult time with scheduling and was always greeted with smiles and even hugs! This office deserves the best reviews I recommend Dr Glassner to anyone that I meet that has difficulty in conceiving a child Thank you, Dr Glassner and staff, for making our family completeI came to mainline fertility after 8 months of trying to conceive In the time I was trying, I had one miscarriage I saw my gyn for a follow up and they brushed me off like it was no big deal I was referred to Main Line Fertility I was treated with such kindness there Not only was it amazing to watch my baby grow - it was a piece of mind to know I would be monitored every week to make sure everything is going smoothly! Thank you Dr Glassner, Rachel, Dr Orris, Nurses and the entire staff at MLF for everything!! Ill be back for baby #2 :)My experience at Main Line Fertility with Dr Glassner and staff was amazingWhen I went to Main Line Fertility, I was a perfectly healthy 38 year old woman with NO reproductive problems In fact, after one round of Clomid, the doctor told me and I quote, that I was a "very fertile 38 year old I gave up hope and told them to donate the sperm sample Now, six years later, I still have no children because the doctor ruined my chances of that, and now I have collection agencies calling me for $400 for some "storage fee" I never heard of until now I have moved on but they keep re-injuring me emotionally by giving me collection calls From the beginning of my IVF treatment I was told everything looked good and was going fine I had to stand outside in the rain for 20 minutes before someone could let me in despite numerous calls to the center which went unanswered I could not contact anyone for a few days  about future cycles, phone calls went straight to voice mailI was a patient of Dr Deanna Brasile's for about 8 months (due to PCOS) and would recommend her and the office at Main line Fertility to anyone who is scared, unsure or nervous about TTC issues There were times I felt depressed, scared and unsure and left the office smiling confident and optimistic because they really know what they are doing and know how to talk to you Dr Brasile went over all possible options regarding medications and answered my questions regarding other "natural" remedies thoroughly and honestly and discussed side effects and potential plans going forward depending on many scenarios Not once did I feel rushed through an appointment, or like I had unanswered questions I've never been to any doctors' office with that level of personal care and attention and as thrilled as I was to "graduate" to a regular ob, I was sad to leave this office
summary: We've been seeing Dr Orris as well as Dr GlassnerSo the first review I did was negative because it took forever to get through my first appointment We got an apology from every person we saw on the way out We were seen by DR Glassner who gave us great care and spent a lot of time answering our questions and explaining things to us They definitely made up for the wait! I've gotten a crazy amount of spam calls daily and I am sure it's from this hack as the timeline fitsAmazing practice! Without MLF I would not have my beautiful 6 month old son Joey! Dr Glassner is a great doctor who never gave up on me! MLF has the following going for it: In Philadelphia area, they have the most amount of donors . and had two successful pregnancies via IVF in 2006 and 2009 . Dr Glassner spent approximately five minutes with me during the initial consultation to determine the 'plan' (and I use that term generously) . I always felt that I was under exceptional care A Doctor or RN was always available to answer my questions or concerns . Thank you Dr Glassner, Rachel, Dr Orris, Nurses and the entire staff at MLF for everything!!

Reviews: The doctors are straight shooters, the appointments might be quick with not a lot of "fluff"Dr Glassner is hands down one of the best doctors in the area Someone always answers the phone and is able and willing to help We'll definitely keep going I had laparoscopic surgery for endometriosis then was cleared to try fertility We met with him and his PA Fertility is always a touchy subject and there's a natural anxiety associated but they do a good job navigating those rough waters Best of luck to you!  This is an absolutely reprehensible practice in the vein of Sam Beauregarde, but never a doctor that I am supposed to be able to trust I will be returning when we are ready for our 2nd child From everyone on the fertility treatment side to the IVF monitoring team- you will not be disappointedWe couldn't even get through the consultation with these folks  I was told, and I quote, "We're sorry, we are not open evening hours"  Since when was 2:00 "evening"?  When they were unwilling to accommodate our schedules, I was asked if we could have two separate consultations, one for her and one for me  They were unwilling  I have still not had an opportunity to speak with the Doctor  I still have no idea what the process is, how much it's going to cost, the risks, the next steps if the this unknown first step doesn't work, etc  Despite multiple requests, they will not let me speak to our DoctorFalse promises made and $14,000 out the window I know no one can guarantee anything, but you trust your doctors This info would have changed our entire plan Explore you options and what is best for your situation Our experience so far exceeds our expectationsI just wanted to update my review I called them to ask about it and they had no clue I am more than satisified; this is not my first fertility doctor They've done more in one visit for me than previous providers have combined Rachel is a wealth of knowledge - ask her anything, really, anything! Don't be embarrassed or shy, she's seen it all! Sue is a doll, but a little rough at first - get to know her, ask her questions - again, a wealth of knowledge This was all new to us so we trusted in Main Line to direct us to the best course of action When it was not successful we asked what could have went wrong If I had known what I know now I would have left the practice long before we spent so much money and time They got us in within a week for our first appointment  Since you are here, you realize this is a difficult time, that is very emotional, and very costly  You rarely see the doctorSo, unless you are desperate for their donor bank, avoid this group like the plague  There are much better groups out there (e  If we decide to go through egg donor again, we are not using them - the emotional stress is absolutely not worth it I didn't start this process expecting any guarantee of a pregnancy What I did expect was that I would receive the appropriate time and care that I deserve as a patient at this practice This is a large practice,  so you must expect to be treated like a number- therefore, you need to demand attention to receive the appropriate care that is best for you and your family Don't be satisfied with sloppy answers that don't quite make sense- make them do their job  A big part of why this practice has such high success rates is because they are aggressive in treatment, and high-throughput They really are the ones who have to keep things running, and deal with whatever the doctors aren't saying to patients Dr Glassner has a quirky sense of humor once you get to know each other  She is very thorough, maintains a positive and aggressive attitude when it comes to getting to the bottom of your fertility troubles  She gets down to business right away and doesn't waste any time They also helped to maintain a sense of humor about the whole process I could not have asked for a better group of people to help us achieve our goal  We are so thankful that we went to them, and they will be our very first call when we decide we are ready for #2!  Unbelievable that we are hearing from them now, find an ethical provider!I cannot thank him enough for what he did I've been to many Infertility Doctors and once I found him, I knew he was the right choice NEVER let the odds deter you from doing what you know in your heart you should do Also, talk about this with your friends, family, and any one who will listen, because you will LEARN you are not alone Here is my story NEVER let the odds deter you from doing what you know in your heart you should do All I can say is he is highly recommended!! I would go up to complete strangers that looked 40'ish and ask them if they received fertility help to conceive their child  I appreciated the way the options were presented to my husband and me with our needs in mind We initially chose to be aggressive and go straight to IVF  I was well trained in the self-injections This was my first experience with anesthesia and I was nervous Kathy, Marg, Shirl and Allison were fantastic  I suggest letting your partner worry about the finances so that you can concentrate on getting pregnant We were intimidated at first, we had no idea of what to expect I enjoyed visiting their office At that point I had decided to switch my gyn office  After a year of hoping/trying -we are expecting a baby in August:-)  I would recommend them to anyone!! The problem was not on my end The doctor refused to let me try a natural insemination and insisted that I go on Clomid in order to "assess my fertility" although the doctor knew that I did not have any reproductive problems Right after that my periods became very light and only lasted about two days Are they kidding me? Now I have to again be emotionally traumatized as I attempt to fight this fee I didn't know about I can't believe that a doctor who ruined my chances of having children now wants me to pay for the storage I never agreed to! Avoid this place at all costs, especially if you do not have any reproductive problems on the female side! ZERO compassion I am sincerely disappointed in Mainline They get your hopes up and then squash them I was shocked because they had not even suggested that something was not going well They are not straightforward with you Unfortunately these are only a few of my grievances with Mainline, but you get the idea I regret ever choosing Mainline and I wish I hadn't So disappointed I've even gotten to appointments early and bumped into the Dr in the parking lot and she recognized me by face and name and pleasantly chatted as we walked to the office together
summary: The doctors are straight shooters, the appointments might be quick with not a lot of fluffDr Glassner is hands down one of the best doctors in the area Someone always answers the phone and is able and willing to help We'll definitely keep going I had laparoscopic surgery for endometriosis then was cleared to try fertility We met with him and his PA Fertility is always a touchy subject and there's a natural anxiety associated but they do a good job navigating those rough waters Best of luck to you! . This is an absolutely reprehensible practice in the vein of Sam Beauregarde, but never a doctor that I am supposed to be able to trust I will be returning when we are ready for our 2nd child From everyone on the fertility treatment side to the IVF monitoring team- you will not be disappointedWe couldn't even get through the consultation with these folks . I was told, and I quote, We're sorry, we are not open evening hours . When they were unwilling to accommodate our schedules, I was asked if we could have two separate consultations, one for her and one for me . I have still not had an opportunity to speak with the Doctor . I still have no idea what the process is, how much it's going to cost, the risks, the next steps if the this unknown first step doesn't work, etc . Don't be embarrassed or shy, she's seen it all! Sue is a doll, but a little rough at first - get to know her, ask her questions - again, a wealth of knowledge This was all new to us so we trusted in Main Line to direct us to the best course of action When it was not successful we asked what could have went wrong If I had known what I know now I would have left the practice long before we spent so much money and time They got us in within a week for our first appointment . Since you are here, you realize this is a difficult time, that is very emotional, and very costly . You rarely see the doctorSo, unless you are desperate for their donor bank, avoid this group like the plague . There are much better groups out there (e . If we decide to go through egg donor again, we are not using them - the emotional stress is absolutely not worth it I didn't start this process expecting any guarantee of a pregnancy What I did expect was that I would receive the appropriate time and care that I deserve as a patient at this practice This is a large practice, . so you must expect to be treated like a number- therefore, you need to demand attention to receive the appropriate care that is best for you and your family Don't be satisfied with sloppy answers that don't quite make sense- make them do their job . A big part of why this practice has such high success rates is because they are aggressive in treatment, and high-throughput They really are the ones who have to keep things running, and deal with whatever the doctors aren't saying to patients Dr Glassner has a quirky sense of humor once you get to know each other . She is very thorough, maintains a positive and aggressive attitude when it comes to getting to the bottom of your fertility troubles . She gets down to business right away and doesn't waste any time They also helped to maintain a sense of humor about the whole process I could not have asked for a better group of people to help us achieve our goal . We are so thankful that we went to them, and they will be our very first call when we decide we are ready for #2! . Unbelievable that we are hearing from them now, find an ethical provider!I cannot thank him enough for what he did I've been to many Infertility Doctors and once I found him, I knew he was the right choice NEVER let the odds deter you from doing what you know in your heart you should do Also, talk about this with your friends, family, and any one who will listen, because you will LEARN you are not alone Here is my story NEVER let the odds deter you from doing what you know in your heart you should do All I can say is he is highly recommended!! I would go up to complete strangers that looked 40'ish and ask them if they received fertility help to conceive their child . I appreciated the way the options were presented to my husband and me with our needs in mind We initially chose to be aggressive and go straight to IVF . I was well trained in the self-injections This was my first experience with anesthesia and I was nervous Kathy, Marg, Shirl and Allison were fantastic . I suggest letting your partner worry about the finances so that you can concentrate on getting pregnant We were intimidated at first, we had no idea of what to expect I enjoyed visiting their office At that point I had decided to switch my gyn office . After a year of hoping/trying -we are expecting a baby in August:-) . The problem was not on my end The doctor refused to let me try a natural insemination and insisted that I go on Clomid in order to assess my fertility although the doctor knew that I did not have any reproductive problems Right after that my periods became very light and only lasted about two days Are they kidding me? Now I have to again be emotionally traumatized as I attempt to fight this fee I didn't know about I can't believe that a doctor who ruined my chances of having children now wants me to pay for the storage I never agreed to! Avoid this place at all costs, especially if you do not have any reproductive problems on the female side! ZERO compassion I am sincerely disappointed in Mainline They get your hopes up and then squash them I was shocked because they had not even suggested that something was not going well They are not straightforward with you Unfortunately these are only a few of my grievances with Mainline, but you get the idea I regret ever choosing Mainline and I wish I hadn't So disappointed I've even gotten to appointments early and bumped into the Dr in the parking lot and she recognized me by face and name and pleasantly chatted as we walked to the office together

Reviews: The entire staff is incredibly kind and compassionate But when you need it, the compassion is there Super fast and amazing that he called himself He was compassionate and caring, but also extremely knowledgeable Nikki, our nurse is amazing as well They even showed me the flexplan policy on the insurance website (public access)  I called MLH at least a 2-3 dozen times (does not include the times my wife called) and they would a) Not return calls after leaving voicemails, emails, and messages at the reception, and 2) refused to give information Everyone seemed knowledgeable and always answered any questions I had Tiffany was extremely helpful in our decision to go with PGD He is an amazing and compassionate man  Everyone was so compassionated and wonderful
summary: The entire staff is incredibly kind and compassionate But when you need it, the compassion is there Super fast and amazing that he called himself He was compassionate and caring, but also extremely knowledgeable Nikki, our nurse is amazing as well They even showed me the flexplan policy on the insurance website (public access) . I called MLH at least a 2-3 dozen times (does not include the times my wife called) and they would a) Not return calls after leaving voicemails, emails, and messages at the reception, and 2) refused to give information Everyone seemed knowledgeable and always answered any questions I had Tiffany was extremely helpful in our decision to go with PGD He is an amazing and compassionate man . Everyone was so compassionated and wonderful

Reviews: The absolute best team you could ever ask for!!!  Everyone on staff is so kind, helpful, and happy!  The physicians are excellent! As is the entire staff!  All team members will spend an unlimited amount of time with you to ensure you understand how to take your medications, calculate timelines, help with financials, anything!  We switched clinics to MLF and couldn't be happier with our IVF results and overall experience  MLF helped make the IVF process as painless and easy as possible! Thank you for everything! Wait times can tend to be long, but there are so many unforeseen emergencies that I cant imagine its easy to plan the schedule perfectly Overall, the quality of care I have received has been excellent He has a great attitude and personality and always follows up when promised In addition, the staff at main line is top notch All the nurses follow-through, call when they say they are going to call and have great experienceI was frustrated and annoyed that it's was 3 hours for an initial appointment Then the staff was overly helpful and apologetic on the way out The staff of nurses is also wonderful The experience I had in this office, to this day effects every internal exam I have Despite stressing how painful exams and my hysteroscopy was, I was dismissed Two nurses joined the one who was helping and my husband was panicked When describing how both procedures went, she stated she had them and they weren't badA little on the pricey side and a tad robotic but the trade off is expertise and efficiency  When you arrive for your visit, it's like an assembly line, or cattle being herded through a cattle chuteThis isn't even the biggest issue we had  If I could give a negative star rating, I wouldHaving owned cattle, I wouldn't have even sent them there for an artificial insemination The office is ran efficientlyThe doctors and nurses were beyond helpful at every appointment You may end up spending a lot of time at this office depending on your course of treatment so it helps to be comfortable with the staff and I can't say enough great things about them  The doctor only works in the mornings on Monday and Wednesday and could not accommodate a 2:00 appointment  I find that very unsettling and unprofessional  We were told from our new clinic that the lab Main Line uses is not as accurate with AMH levels as other labs that are used by other clinics Was told not to do Shared Risk where I would get my money back if it didn't work out because ivf would work for me the first time, and again, obviously we lost all our money We are in early stages but feel so confident with our choice of the Orris and Bloom team We feel so much more informed at Main Line Our wait tumes are minimal, which are important to us due to my partners heavy schedule and the clinic is flexible when they can be ( cycle wise) with us since leaving this place I was informed my medical records were compromised  I called above them (Women's healthcare) and come to find out yes it's my records from Mainline But this further validates my negative thoughts on this place after 8 months, I'm still haunted by this place Would go back to this team in a heartbeat! This was NEVER mentioned during our time with Main Line From the first phone call the staff was extremely accommodating and friendlyThey are always running very lateThe fees are much higher than at another place I went to in another stateOnce I walked in because of an emergency and they wouldn't even let me sit in the waiting roomTheir attitude and service is deplorable  During these lab visits she did not see a provider, they only drew blood2) They were constantly late for their appointments, even if you were signed up for the very first appointment of the day3) The nurses do the monitoring, not the doctors  Other places you see a doctor more often (e  One person, at the billing department, was incredibly rude to me and hung the phone up on me a few times  I asked my insurance company to call this rude person, and they did multiple times not getting information  At one point, the representative at the insurance company told me she has never spoken to anyone who was so rudeThe staff, however is excellent- I found all of the nurses extremely supportive and efficient  Billing is a different story I'm currently unable to get anyone in the billing department to call me back The nurses were so empathetic and really worked on my behalf with the insurance company  I will say that some of the front desk staff at the West Chester location have total attitude problems and will roll their eyes and give you a problem if you ask them to do anything above and beyond to assist you, but if you can ignore them, the Drs, ultrasound techs and nurses are very good here  I find that the front desk staff and most Drs offices have attitude problems, but I guess I thought they would be a bit more sensitive at this type of office I was immediately impressed by the nurturing/efficient atmosphere Everyone from the front desk, nurses and other staff went above and beyond the call of duty Wait times were short, front desk always answered the phone or returned calls promptly  Infertility is a very challenging and heartbreaking experience, and the staff and Main Line Fertility could not have treated us betterWe had an unhappy experience with the practice 13 years ago, now we are being billed for embryo storage despite the clear language of their own contractMain Line Fertility and their entire team are GREAT!! Dr Orris is the BEST around!! You cannot get any better  I was immediately impressed with the staff at MLF  The front desk is very accommodating  I found it very easy to schedule appointments There are early morning appointments at 7 am which made it easy for me to balance work and my frequent appointments  Reaching the office by phone was never an issue The office never left me on hold for extended periods of time nor did I have to wait for someone to pick up the phone  Michelle at the check-out desk is friendly and very accommodating  The office is run extremely efficiently, which I truly appreciate since I was often there 3 times a week  The Ultrasound techs and nurses are experienced, knowledgeable and empathetic I was glad that all of my procedures were done in the BM office and I did not have to go elsewhere  The IVF RNs are fantastic - Peg, Nikki, Kristen and Bridget were excellent to work with The nurses are unbelievable and they made it very easy I was impressed with their positive attitude and empathy The OR staff are exceptionally positive and supportive The staff was wonderful  They made the experience a pleasant one  This was the only frustration I had during the office experience   Ensure you know the billing POC and where to contact her  I have never been to a physician's office that was so well run from the front desk to the clinical staff His opening line was, "If you follow my directions, you will be pregnant His office staff is warm, welcoming and so pleasant DrGlassner and Rachel were such a god sent! They were always there for any questions I had, called me with blood results the SAME day (which is unheard of)! The nursing staff was amazing! In turn I ended up getting pregnant, and was monitored here until my 9th week of pregnancy That has not changed since I went to Main Line Fertility They never told me about any paperwork at that time that had to be filled outThis is one of the worst experiences I have ever had Further, they do not treat their patients well I rearranged my schedule for a 7am appointment and arrived to find the doors locked I will never do business with them nor would I ever suggest them, even to my worst enemy Lots of heartache and lost hope The staff is very friendly, helpful and accommodating and everyone is sensitive to your personal issues I've visited all 3 offices (bryn mawr, paoli and west chester) and had wonderful experiences at each
summary: The absolute best team you could ever ask for!!! . Everyone on staff is so kind, helpful, and happy! . All team members will spend an unlimited amount of time with you to ensure you understand how to take your medications, calculate timelines, help with financials, anything! . We switched clinics to MLF and couldn't be happier with our IVF results and overall experience . MLF helped make the IVF process as painless and easy as possible! When you arrive for your visit, it's like an assembly line, or cattle being herded through a cattle chuteThis isn't even the biggest issue we had . If I could give a negative star rating, I wouldHaving owned cattle, I wouldn't have even sent them there for an artificial insemination The office is ran efficientlyThe doctors and nurses were beyond helpful at every appointment You may end up spending a lot of time at this office depending on your course of treatment so it helps to be comfortable with the staff and I can't say enough great things about them . The doctor only works in the mornings on Monday and Wednesday and could not accommodate a 2:00 appointment . I find that very unsettling and unprofessional . I called above them (Women's healthcare) and come to find out yes it's my records from Mainline But this further validates my negative thoughts on this place after 8 months, I'm still haunted by this place Would go back to this team in a heartbeat! At one point, the representative at the insurance company told me she has never spoken to anyone who was so rudeThe staff, however is excellent- I found all of the nurses extremely supportive and efficient . Billing is a different story I'm currently unable to get anyone in the billing department to call me back The nurses were so empathetic and really worked on my behalf with the insurance company . I will say that some of the front desk staff at the West Chester location have total attitude problems and will roll their eyes and give you a problem if you ask them to do anything above and beyond to assist you, but if you can ignore them, the Drs, ultrasound techs and nurses are very good here . I find that the front desk staff and most Drs offices have attitude problems, but I guess I thought they would be a bit more sensitive at this type of office I was immediately impressed by the nurturing/efficient atmosphere Everyone from the front desk, nurses and other staff went above and beyond the call of duty Wait times were short, front desk always answered the phone or returned calls promptly . I was immediately impressed with the staff at MLF . I found it very easy to schedule appointments There are early morning appointments at 7 am which made it easy for me to balance work and my frequent appointments . Reaching the office by phone was never an issue The office never left me on hold for extended periods of time nor did I have to wait for someone to pick up the phone . Michelle at the check-out desk is friendly and very accommodating . The office is run extremely efficiently, which I truly appreciate since I was often there 3 times a week . The Ultrasound techs and nurses are experienced, knowledgeable and empathetic I was glad that all of my procedures were done in the BM office and I did not have to go elsewhere . They were always there for any questions I had, called me with blood results the SAME day (which is unheard of)!

Reviews: I strongly recommend this office for growing your family! During my tube test I hyperventilated I was in so much pain  Multiple times they applied the used car salesman mentality where they would get us separated and try to  pressure my wife to make a decision on what we were going to do at a visit before we could discuss it I have recommended multiple women to this practice and will continue to do so I also will be back the next time we decide to conceive  My wife has had tests done and I have provided a semen analysis  (Wish I knew that at the time) With that said, I would recommend them for IUIs since they are much cheaper than other places I know women who had successful iuis Just be careful before jumping to IVFMy partner and I started IVF at Main Line after failed IUI at Penn and so far we are incredibly happy we switched Dr G is great at developing a plan that works and is specific for and to YOU We did one round of IUI and one round of IVF When going through IVF if we were told this we probably would have paid extra to have the manual insemination of the sperm into my eggMy wife and I were not able to benefit from IVF, so ended up going through the egg donor process  Earlier this spring, we went back to MLF in the hopes of conceiving our third child using frozen embryos Long story short, the subsequent transfer resulted in a chemical pregnancy, and we have no embryos left to try again  We were charged an embryo storage fee for embryos that no longer exist, and despite the fact that I've contacted their office multiple times, I've now received a notice from a collection agency for the amount due I cannot recommend MLF more fully  Within three months I had gone through all the diagnostic testing, and two rounds of clomid + progesterone and now I'm pregnant  Nonetheless, I still recommend themAfter trying to conceive naturally for 15+ months, my husband and I went to Main Line Fertility  Just under 3 months of testing and treatment, we are now entering the second trimester of pregnancy with our first child  My wife's medication was mishandled at the time, but we were very fortunate that there were no side effect and that we ultimately got pregnant naturallyAt age 36, through intercourse, I got pregnant and had a healthy baby Then from ages 38 through 41, I had secondary infertility My sixth IVF (first time with Dr Orris) resulted into healthy baby My mother says it's no ones business I was past the IUIs and went with Dr Orris' protocol and had a healthy baby at 41!! I am now 44 and had a healthy baby because of him and his team! Dr Orris is the BEST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  We did 3 cycles of drugs and 3 egg retrievals We utilized PGD and we were very glad that we chose to get the embryos tested At that time, we decided to take a step back and try IUI We did two rounds of IUI, the second round in combination with acupuncture  The second round of IUI, we achieve success!  The billing can be difficult to understand" After a few cycles of clomid, he was right I went to be inseminated with a sperm sample I had purchased from a sperm bank" Well, that did not last long, because guess what? He made me continue on Clomid and after the second round which was just one round after the "assessment" round,, I suffered a rare side effect from the drug which is a thinning of the uterine lining This only occurs on about 1% of women who take Clomid, or so I was told I went off the drug, but then when I went back to get tested, my uterine lining was still too thin It never recovered after many months Then two days before my surgery they tell me I haven't been responding to the medication and that my cycle is cancelled
summary: I strongly recommend this office for growing your family! During my tube test I hyperventilated I was in so much pain . Multiple times they applied the used car salesman mentality where they would get us separated and try to . pressure my wife to make a decision on what we were going to do at a visit before we could discuss it I have recommended multiple women to this practice and will continue to do so I also will be back the next time we decide to conceive . My wife has had tests done and I have provided a semen analysis . ( Earlier this spring, we went back to MLF in the hopes of conceiving our third child using frozen embryos Long story short, the subsequent transfer resulted in a chemical pregnancy, and we have no embryos left to try again . We were charged an embryo storage fee for embryos that no longer exist, and despite the fact that I've contacted their office multiple times, I've now received a notice from a collection agency for the amount due I cannot recommend MLF more fully . Within three months I had gone through all the diagnostic testing, and two rounds of clomid + progesterone and now I'm pregnant . Nonetheless, I still recommend themAfter trying to conceive naturally for 15+ months, my husband and I went to Main Line Fertility . Just under 3 months of testing and treatment, we are now entering the second trimester of pregnancy with our first child . My wife's medication was mishandled at the time, but we were very fortunate that there were no side effect and that we ultimately got pregnant naturallyAt age 36, through intercourse, I got pregnant and had a healthy baby Then from ages 38 through 41, I had secondary infertility My sixth IVF (first time with Dr Orris) resulted into healthy baby My mother says it's no ones business I was past the IUIs and went with Dr Orris' protocol and had a healthy baby at 41!! I am now 44 and had a healthy baby because of him and his team! We did 3 cycles of drugs and 3 egg retrievals We utilized PGD and we were very glad that we chose to get the embryos tested At that time, we decided to take a step back and try IUI We did two rounds of IUI, the second round in combination with acupuncture . The second round of IUI, we achieve success! . The billing can be difficult to understand After a few cycles of clomid, he was right I went to be inseminated with a sperm sample I had purchased from a sperm bank Well, that did not last long, because guess what? He made me continue on Clomid and after the second round which was just one round after the assessment round,, I suffered a rare side effect from the drug which is a thinning of the uterine lining This only occurs on about 1% of women who take Clomid, or so I was told I went off the drug, but then when I went back to get tested, my uterine lining was still too thin It never recovered after many months Then two days before my surgery they tell me I haven't been responding to the medication and that my cycle is cancelled

Reviews: My first issue with their level of service After losing my $14,000 within 24 hours, I was then charged $25 for my records  Luckily, Women's healthcare is offering fraud protection  Below are some examples about the service we received1) My wife thought it was odd that she paid a co-pay for labs only (drawing blood) WHen typically going to a lab you pay co-insurance, not co-pay You typically pay co-pay when seeing a provider, RMA), where you talk to your doctor and ask questions4) They are adamant the egg donor fee is not covered by any insurance  I spent close to a year going back and forth with them and the insurance company My insurance company explicitly told me they would cover (via flexplan) - they just needed certain information Don't worry, she did this to the insurance company agents as well  They would refuse to fill out the insurance provided documentationon top of that, MLF accused the insurance claims agent of trying to get MLF to commit insurance fraud! Why would the insurance company want a doctor to do this is beyond me  In the end, after almost a year, my insurance company gave up, and DID pay the flex plan claim ($1,800)Dr Glassner had me talk to Eileen the study coordinator who was able to put me in a study study that saved me a lot of money, and he was right, it worked! They work very hard to help reduce the very expensive costs of IVF through studies, or referring you to other places that would help with financing We submitted this to our insurance after the procedure and to our surprise,  insurance covered the PDG minus the currier fee  I would suggest that you keep on top of the billing department to ensure all claims are submitted and paid I NEVER told them to store that sample and they never mentioned any fee to me when I was there

I spent close to a year going back and forth with them and the insurance company My insurance company explicitly told me they would cover (via flexplan) - they just needed certain information Don't worry, she did this to the insurance company agents as well . They would refuse to fill out the insurance provided documentationon top of that, MLF accused the insurance claims agent of trying to get MLF to commit insurance fraud! Why would the insurance company want a doctor to do this is beyond me . In the end, after almost a year, my insurance company gave up, and DID pay the flex plan claim ($1,800)Dr Glassner had me talk to Eileen the study coordinator who was able to put me in a study study that saved me a lot of money, and he was right, it worked! They work very hard to help reduce the very expensive costs of IVF through studies, or referring you to other places that would help with financing We submitted this to our insurance after the procedure and to our surprise, . insurance covered the PDG minus the currier fee . I would suggest that you keep on top of the billing department to ensure all claims are submitted and paid I NEVER told them to store that sample and they never mentioned any fee to me when I was there
