Reviews: 2018 update: Have been back for a quick consultation with Dr Butts She was extremely kind and generous, professional and thoughtful She had performed a procedure for me two years ago and remembered me, and took time with my partner and behaved in a compassionate way You will call and not receive calls back If you do, the person will have no familiarity or concern for your case Which, by the way, will not be updated with current information That's the first and last time I've ever seen that doctor Makes you feel real confident At no point was this explained that it would essentially be billed as a surgery or a procedure Edwards who we saw once in 16 months and another doctor we never even heard of Best part of during the consultation he sat there bewildered by my wife's chart and not understanding what the fuck Penn was trying to do  Were taking our business else where  WeHave an appointment at Mainline fertility w Dr Glassner While we do like our Dr, you rarely get to see your Doc I highly recommend going someplace else if you can I have received successful top-notch fertility treatment in Japan and I felt that my experience here was merely so-so at best I saw Dr Divya Shah at Radnor several times  as we were having trouble conceiving our second As opposed to one of the doctors at Shady Grove who was extremely pessimistic and basically said there wasn't much he could do to help me and that I had a 'really tough case' Funny how I was pregnant without any assistance within 2 weeks of that consultation Dr Shah had a MUCH better understanding of how to approach diminished ovarian reservelong story short I asked her if am I gonna be able to have a healthy baby from our own?do we have everything normal? and she said my husband morph is abnormal but just a little bitI feel like they just want to get the money first and don't care about our feelingsWithout going into too much detail, let's just say that due to our age and due to the nature of our problem, we probably had around a 20-30% chance of carrying a pregnancy to full term In fact we changed fertility clinics to Penn because our previous doctor (who shall remain nameless but let's just say he was based at Bryn Mawr Hospital) didn't have a very good manner of explaining this to us We were well aware of the odds against us, and he basically acted like he was doing us a favor by even trying to treat us because chances are it wouldn't work You see, there is a way to explain these things in a realistic manner, yet do it in a positive way to encourage instead of discourage We truly felt like the staff was rooting for us instead of treating us like we were a burden due to our circumstancesFirst thing I'd like to say is that anyone looking for fertility intervention should read 'Making Babies' by Sami S David & Jill Blakeway The first chapter is all you need to read to understand what is happening at Penn Fertility Care The results were given to me right after it was done as I was sitting in front of 4 strangers (not sure why 4 people needed to be in the room) I was obviously completely devastated and very little compassion was doled out However it was the upsetting results and the massive amount of bleeding following the procedure that told me that I really should have had someone bring me I had ridden the train for god sake! My main takeaway from this experience - do not go alone to an HSG! My husband and I were then told on our next visit that our absolute only chance of conception was IVF My husband and I left stunned with disbelief that creating life has come down to this type of commercialization I have integrated supplements, diet changes, acupuncture (Cara Frank is amazing), mayan massage (Jennifer Harrison is awesome), and a few other things into my life This time it hurt unbelievably bad, but showed that both fallopian tubes were completely open! Even though I had done the work to get them open, I still had a hard time believing it Now it has been a couple months and we are crossing our fingers and toes for a positive test result  In that time, I met almost every doctor, but as I was considered a patient of Dr Edwards, it was he who I mostly saw (and he who followed up with me when necessary)  But the empathy and personal attention from Gloria, Brooke, and (I am so sorry that I don't recall her name) the other woman who were the ultrasound team at the 8th/Walnut group was amazing  I loved how honest the doctors and nurses were- at some fertility practices, they are all "sunshine and roses", and while I appreciate that some people need a team that will tell them gentle lies to make them feel better, I needed a team who was going to be honest about my chances, and cut to the chase The doctor seems that he cares about only money, gave me unnecessary surgery As I want to know what the polyps are, no body would like to tell me I've had a good experience with Dr Barnhart and his nurse after switching from Main Line Fertility due to canceled cyclesDr Barnhart switched my protocol, which was successfulDr Coutifaris performed my retrieval and showed his sense of humor by writing the number of embryos retrieved on my hand Dr Dokras performed my transfer and was very thorough talking me through everything I've also worked with Dr Butts before for my laparoscopy They tell you a sample must get there within an hour so why is that not the case this time???!!!! On another occasion I had a nurse laughing when we were talking about my infertility I was treated like just a number - get the tests then straight to IUIMy husband and I went to see Dr Dokras for infertility treatment We had a terrible experience with Dr Dokras We would not recommend this facility There are many great facilities out there that will treat you with the respect and care you deserveI have to leave a review for this practice, because my experience has been nothing like the previous reviewer  My doctor is Dr Dokras  These fellows are all currently physicians in the field and they have wonderful bedside manner- something that is EXTREMELY important if you are a fertility patient)Before you dismiss this office due to the previous review, please check it out yourselfThis is meant to be scathing, and not meant for Dr Butts, whom I wish was our assigned doctor, and a few very kind nurses We could almost never get in touch with a doctor or nurse when we wanted to, and the times we could were rushed off the phoneThe final straw: A test showed that a Fallopian tube might have a blockage, meaning the the procedures we had done were quite possibly a complete waste of time, tears and money: and the doctor NEVER told me At that, my husband and I went to Shady Grove Fertility and are thrilled with the switch Go to a clinic with human decency during this incredibly emotional, trying timeI received respect and superb care from the front desk staff to the doctors My main Dr was Dr Barnhart who was wonderful, but I received care from Dr Butts, Dr Dokras, and Dr Coutafaris (name misspelled), who's the head doctorAfter getting the run around from MainLine, who could've changed my protocol immediately but figured they milk the money off my insurance since it paid for IVF, Dr Barnhart reviewed my history and changed my protocol and everything went smoothly Dr Dokras let me view the screen during my transfer and explained everything step-by-stepIt is just cute how all negative reviews of this practice are dismissed under "Not recommended" I have never experienced doctors actually take the time to get to know you and really care about you! I have had NO health problem after donating!!! Love them  We are a same-sex couple that needed an egg donor and surrogate  Dr G was also a gem when helping us work through some less than typical situations that arose  She made herself very available throughout the processes as we needed her  That was incredibly appreciated during what is a very emotional process  We ultimately had a successful pregnancy on the first try and had a baby within a year of our first visit to the clinicMy interaction with one of the doctora as this practive left me feeling dismissed and unvalued  Whenever the discussion of IVF came up, and I informed this dr that it was not an option for me- he would shut down  When I told him i had to visit ER two days prior due to an unusual discharge, he first told me to stop taking the antibiotics, then told me to keep taking them, have intercourse that night, and call them to let them know if the issue persisted  We are already extremely distraught after experiencing miscarriages, and failed IUI's  While the doctor (DrButts) is very knowledgable, you will barely get to see her ever, and when you do, she will rush through the interaction and leave you with questions and concerns afterwards  We went there for about 8 months and they barely ran any tests on me or my husband  I only saw the doctor once or twice, usually it was the nurse, and the dr  I asked to try fertility meds one month (they didn't recommend them or even mention them to me) and the nurse gave them to me without any explanation  I felt completely alone and unmonitored I'm in the middle of my treatments with them so am not pregnant yet, but I have never considered going anywhere else-- I don't get the sense that they are all about numbers, I think they care about individual patients and cases, and they try to develop a protocol that will work for you as an individual The doctors are all excellent-- we've gotten treatments during some very inclement weather meaning that doctors had to switch around schedules-- and they were always available for us
summary: WeHave an appointment at Mainline fertility w Dr Glassner While we do like our Dr, you rarely get to see your Doc I highly recommend going someplace else if you can I have received successful top-notch fertility treatment in Japan and I felt that my experience here was merely so-so at best I saw Dr Divya Shah at Radnor several times . as we were having trouble conceiving our second As opposed to one of the doctors at Shady Grove who was extremely pessimistic and basically said there wasn't much he could do to help me and that I had a 'really tough case' Funny how I was pregnant without any assistance within 2 weeks of that consultation Dr Shah had a MUCH better understanding of how to approach diminished ovarian reservelong story short I asked her if am I gonna be able to have a healthy baby from our own?do we have everything normal? My main takeaway from this experience - do not go alone to an HSG! My husband and I were then told on our next visit that our absolute only chance of conception was IVF My husband and I left stunned with disbelief that creating life has come down to this type of commercialization I have integrated supplements, diet changes, acupuncture (Cara Frank is amazing), mayan massage (Jennifer Harrison is awesome), and a few other things into my life This time it hurt unbelievably bad, but showed that both fallopian tubes were completely open! Even though I had done the work to get them open, I still had a hard time believing it Now it has been a couple months and we are crossing our fingers and toes for a positive test result . In that time, I met almost every doctor, but as I was considered a patient of Dr Edwards, it was he who I mostly saw (and he who followed up with me when necessary) . But the empathy and personal attention from Gloria, Brooke, and (I am so sorry that I don't recall her name) the other woman who were the ultrasound team at the 8th/Walnut group was amazing . On another occasion I had a nurse laughing when we were talking about my infertility I was treated like just a number - get the tests then straight to IUIMy husband and I went to see Dr Dokras for infertility treatment We had a terrible experience with Dr Dokras We would not recommend this facility There are many great facilities out there that will treat you with the respect and care you deserveI have to leave a review for this practice, because my experience has been nothing like the previous reviewer . I have had NO health problem after donating!!! We are a same-sex couple that needed an egg donor and surrogate . Dr G was also a gem when helping us work through some less than typical situations that arose . She made herself very available throughout the processes as we needed her . That was incredibly appreciated during what is a very emotional process . We ultimately had a successful pregnancy on the first try and had a baby within a year of our first visit to the clinicMy interaction with one of the doctora as this practive left me feeling dismissed and unvalued . Whenever the discussion of IVF came up, and I informed this dr that it was not an option for me- he would shut down . When I told him i had to visit ER two days prior due to an unusual discharge, he first told me to stop taking the antibiotics, then told me to keep taking them, have intercourse that night, and call them to let them know if the issue persisted . We are already extremely distraught after experiencing miscarriages, and failed IUI's . While the doctor (DrButts) is very knowledgable, you will barely get to see her ever, and when you do, she will rush through the interaction and leave you with questions and concerns afterwards . We went there for about 8 months and they barely ran any tests on me or my husband . I only saw the doctor once or twice, usually it was the nurse, and the dr . I asked to try fertility meds one month (they didn't recommend them or even mention them to me) and the nurse gave them to me without any explanation . I felt completely alone and unmonitored I'm in the middle of my treatments with them so am not pregnant yet, but I have never considered going anywhere else-- I don't get the sense that they are all about numbers, I think they care about individual patients and cases, and they try to develop a protocol that will work for you as an individual The doctors are all excellent-- we've gotten treatments during some very inclement weather meaning that doctors had to switch around schedules-- and they were always available for us

Reviews: 2016: University of Pennsylvania Fertility is a disaster I promise you will never see "your" doctor, you will probably never see the same doctor If you disregard reviews and decide to go anyway be very sure to ask every question you can think of about every step of the process They will not help you, they will not advocate for you, they will not go the extra mile My wife chose Penn and unfortunately I didn't read the google and yelp reviews We waited 3 months to get an appointment with Edwards So the first unpleasant surprise She doesn't have a medical history that would lead to this happening and they offered no explanation how this would occur Mind you we're operating under the assumption that she can't get pregnant if she's right side dominate The nurse walks in celebrating apparently not knowing that my wife's right side tube is blocked (once again it wasn't, but unfortunately we had no clue thanks to the medical experts at penn) I almost lost my shit and snapped at this woman I work in sales for a living, I never go into a meeting with a client not knowing every piece of info we have on them But it gets better There goes another 120 dollars So we should waste a procedure that we have a limited number of that won't work???? Also you don't even know if she already ovulated Have had 4 visits and every-time I see the actual doctor Also figures out my wife's tube wasn't blocked Seriously run the fuck away from this place  They are primarily sales pl not likeDocs normally arePoor communication and disappointing experience overall I wish I had read these reviews instead of trusting other people's opinions Look into other places with a better reputation She did a fertility work up and although I have some major potential issues she remained optimistic I guess that's what happens when your more focused on your job and helping precooked and not just the bottom lobe i called and asking for explanation but no one call back until I emailed the embryologist she said I have to talk to dr Very discouraging I went there in February of 2016 We stayed for the IVF lecture that night We were given a sales pitch that would make a used car salesman salivate The words "you get 5 doctors for the price of 1" actually came out of the mouth of Dr ButtsI looked into other options on my own and proceeded with many types of natural therapies One good resource is natural-fertility-info I could feel the changes in my body and my period I have complete respect for any path a person takes to parenthood, but I want to let people know that sometimes these fertility clinics do not have the best intentions or are just not informed of all ways possible for women to become mothers Trust your intuition and make sure you feel completely comfortable with the course of action the doctor wants to take, otherwise you will be left with complete disappointment  I will never forget Gloria holding my hand and crying with me when I had a loss  I searched the medicine online, as one of these side effect happens, patients should notify the doctor and stop the medicine immediately In fact, nobody will tell you This practice is a disgrace We had and continue to have a very high opinion of Penn Fetal Medicine She was uneducated and unsympathetic to our needs After our initial appointment with her, we decided to go to another fertility center in Philadelphia We were shocked and disappointed with the lack of knowledge, attention and sensitivity that we experienced hereThe reason you do not always see the same doctor is that UPenn is a teaching hospital and this office has a fellowship program for doctors who are becoming instructors  On most visits you will see a fellow, but you will also see your own doctor as well  You can also request to only see your doctor if that is preferred  I always have detailed instructions and a plan  (something that is also very important for fertility patients They ran the standard battery of tests, charged us twice for most, and never explained anything I looked up the report and researched every unfamiliar medical term until I interpreted the report myselfI've switched from MainLine Fertility to here and it was a wise choice Some of them actually contain valuable points, now that I am a patient there myself "Stay on 450 units", when your dose is actually 300 units, so PREPARE TO DOUBLECHECK their every step Or so I thought when less than 24 hours before my last retrieval they told me they have no donor sperm prepared for me Prepare to a lot of stress and omissions  During the next conversation his reply was - so you're just going to go with nature's course  His bedside manner was unprofessional;  upon a pelvic exam, he never advised me of inserting the speculum , or his fingers You will be run through lengthy trials that are known to fail, before they finally prescribe correctly And to top things off, if you are expecting results, you basically have to call/bug them Avoid if possible  Very little oversight  I did have one initial visit at Radnor, which is where I had wanted to do some of my care (and per their website, locations are interchangeable - yeah, right!)  Having come from another fertility practice where I saw a doctor during each visit, it was a shock to never see my doctor, a doctor, or my nurse during most visits  While I could have been more comfortable with this arrangement if I felt that I had easy access to my nurse or doctor in other ways, I felt disconnected from my care and without power to ask simple questions and get feedback But, since they really didn't have much sway in my regular visits with this office, I had to give 1 star  You should wait and you better not ask questions  She barked at me almost every time I came  She singlehandedly made my visits incredibly frustrating and unpleasant (which were already stressful b/c I was undergoing FERTILITY treatments - duh!)  If you have a choice, I suggest that you RUN to another practice!  (Try RMA)
summary: Also you don't even know if she already ovulated Have had 4 visits and every-time I see the actual doctor Also figures out my wife's tube wasn't blocked Seriously run the fuck away from this place . I will never forget Gloria holding my hand and crying with me when I had a loss . On most visits you will see a fellow, but you will also see your own doctor as well . You can also request to only see your doctor if that is preferred . I always have detailed instructions and a plan . ( During the next conversation his reply was - so you're just going to go with nature's course . upon a pelvic exam, he never advised me of inserting the speculum , or his fingers You will be run through lengthy trials that are known to fail, before they finally prescribe correctly And to top things off, if you are expecting results, you basically have to call/bug them Avoid if possible . I did have one initial visit at Radnor, which is where I had wanted to do some of my care (and per their website, locations are interchangeable - yeah, right!) . Having come from another fertility practice where I saw a doctor during each visit, it was a shock to never see my doctor, a doctor, or my nurse during most visits . While I could have been more comfortable with this arrangement if I felt that I had easy access to my nurse or doctor in other ways, I felt disconnected from my care and without power to ask simple questions and get feedback But, since they really didn't have much sway in my regular visits with this office, I had to give 1 star . You should wait and you better not ask questions . She barked at me almost every time I came . She singlehandedly made my visits incredibly frustrating and unpleasant (which were already stressful b/c I was undergoing FERTILITY treatments - duh!) . If you have a choice, I suggest that you RUN to another practice! . (

Reviews: Incredibly frustrating She was knowledgeable and very compassionateafter she respond my email, nurse called the next day and we set up a meeting for the explanation  I have had WONDERFUL, compassionate, timely care at this office (3701 Market Street)  (Two heads is better than one!)I always get a call from the nurse (nurse Susan you ROCK!!) on the same day that I call or visit, and there is always follow-through with my care My nurse communicates via text when I need to, and although I didn't realize that so much of the process would be done with nurses, it's very important that you feel comfortable with your nurse, which I do

I have had WONDERFUL, compassionate, timely care at this office (3701 Market Street) . (Two heads is better than one!)I always get a call from the nurse (nurse Susan you ROCK!!) on the same day that I call or visit, and there is always follow-through with my care My nurse communicates via text when I need to, and although I didn't realize that so much of the process would be done with nurses, it's very important that you feel comfortable with your nurse, which I do

Reviews: Individually, many of the nurses, doctors, residents, and receptionists are extremely competent and kind, however as a system, the place is run like the DMV in the 1980's If you have specific medical concerns, you will need to remind every single medical "professional" of them, because they will not read your chartRun, seriously run I have never dealt with a more incompetent group of people in my life For 14-16 months we discussed treatment plans with a revolving door of nurses My wife comes in and yay follicle on the left side They tell us come back 2 days later so we can measure the follicle again 2 days later and now the right side is dominate Now once again with the revolving door of nurses The nurse looks at us and says, well come back into 2 more days and we will check again So 2 days later back in the office and now magically the left follicle has disappeared and they don't know if my wife ovulated  That was our last visit We chose a different fertility clinic, one that's highly recommendedHorrible experience  I definitely wouldn't return to Penn fertility  He's supposed to be the best in this area  I'd steer clear of Penn unless you want your appointments to be more like dealing a salesman at the gym My wife asked the nurse to confirm this since she normally takes it at 18mm, the nurse confirmed 5:15  PM she gets a phone call from a different person "confirming her instructions" (which they have never done before), and those instructions are to take the shot on Saturday Just awful customer service in an already tough situation This is not our first negative experience with Penn Fertility My experience at Penn Fertility was very mediocre at best There was nothing to rave about at this clinic I sincerely regret not going to a different clinic with better reviews  If you are considering Penn Fertility, don't do it The communication at this place just isn't what it needs to beI should've search and read about this all bad review before I went to penn fertility clinic barnhart and apparently I only spoke couple times before I start the ivf program and after that everything is all nurse Top it off with the errors his staff were making during our care there, and our experience stunk at that location We researched and decided to switch to Penn The doctors we dealt with at Penn were excellent at this And the bottom line Despite the odds against us, our healthy son was born last month due to the care we received from Penn I had no issues with their staff, everyone seemed very professional and actually a bit rehearsed I did feel a bit like a science project as on my first visit I had a ton of blood taken for testing and a transvaginal ultrasound and was scheduled for an HSG the next day The worst part was I had come alone as I was told I could because it was a simple outpatient service I will have to say the procedure was actually done very quickly and smoothly with no pain, which it is apparently rare not to have pain, which I would later learn This past February (1 year later) I scheduled another HSG with my gynecologistI first would like to say that I mostly went to the 8th/ Walnut offices (except on holidays or weekends when I went to 3701 Market St)  I felt like they were compassionate and empathetic, and their support staff was excellent  Over all of my treatments, I got to know the women who did the ultrasounds, the blood draw staff, and the nurses The blood draws were always painless at 8th/Walnut, and the nursing staff was professional and compassionate  You can train people to do their jobs efficiently, but you cannot train people to be as loving and caring as those women were to me  The only reason that I didn't give it 5 stars, by the way, is because I didn't feel the same amount of professionalism at the Market St location  Although, I really only went there on holidays and weekends, so they may have had a staff during the week who was also fabulous  But I always waited for ages at the Market St location- including one day when I was completely forgotten about when I was there for a monitoring appointment  But always, once I was seen, I was treated with professional courtesyThey are not that great as I thought As I called the nurse to notify the severe side effect, heavy bleeding and belly pain) and asked if I could stop the clomid, she said continue and take some ibuprofen if feel pain They are so unprofessional The nurses there are not friendly at allThey are not helping, they are destroying your reproduction system with a lot of bills too His nurse showered me with compliments and sympathy after the loss When I didn't return for a 7 week ultrasound, she checked up on me When I called the office with numerous questions a nurse always answered Especially to those with endometriosisDO NOT GO HERE!!! I went for an IUI only to be told 20 minutes later that a doctor was not there and that I needed to go to the city This place needs some serious sensitivity and professionalism training I have never  been treated with such disrespect and lack of compassion during what is a very stressful and painful time We were referred by Penn Fetal Medicine who we had a fantastic experience with We have had an amazing experience at the other fertility center  I have been a patient at the office for two yearsThere are actually two head receptionists, Madeline and Teresa- both who have been incredibly kind to me in my many interactions in person and over the phoneYes- I have waited over 25 minutes on occasion, but that is NOT the norm  On most visits, including visits to get blood work, I have only waited about 5 minutes  In my experience, the fellows are thorough, communicative with me and the attending physician and compassionate  However, I have found that seeing more doctors has been great for me, as they are working as a team to care for me  You may love it, like me! The majority of Penn Fertility staff, however, treated my husband and I terribly during a really difficult time The receptionists were often rude, unintelligent and unhelpful Though we left the practice in December, we received several harassing, enormous bills, which we have just resolvedPenn will abuse and try rob you I would've given 5 stars if the wait time was better and they offered 7 a lab time in their officeThe overall level of service there is VERY uneven At first, I gave the place the nickname "Hot mess with a happy ending" They will completely forget you are coming fro your initial appointment, and casually show up 45 minutes past scheduled time, having not reviewed your chart With that, they are pleasant, their heart is in the right place, and their system is overall effective That means, that my airhead nurse just did not bother to check until it was less than one day before the procedure, on a Sunday afternoon Honestly, that was a bit too much to take Again, in the very end, they found the sperm and did the procedure, but until the last minute, gowned up and with the IV in, I did know if the procedure is still happening With that, they still achieve results, and are the closest group for Center City people geographically which becomes important when you do US and bloodwork every other day People I liked: Drs Shah, Kalra, Garcia; nurses Erin and Rie (both VERY professional), US tech -- I think her name is Julie? The receptionist actually treated me very nice and was very accomodating of my needs (I had to take an early train and thus cut the line a coupla times) Keeba the biller is also very approachable and helped me with wrongly filed bills And they are amazing!!! I never have to wait more then 5 minutes in the waiting room The nurse that takes my blood is AMAZING!!! I never feel it in or out and never get a bruise! They treat you with the most respect and careWe are very pleased with Penn Fertility  We interviewed several fertility clinics and ultimately chose Penn and could not be happier that we did  The third-party coordinator was amazing at helping us coordinate all of the moving pieces for our surrogacy journey, even when there were some kinks thrown in unexpectedly  We cannot be happier and are over the moon with our little bundle of joy  We plan on using Penn again to make him a big brother soon  Other than thatm he said  I was fine, he was pretty sure I'd be fine, and to keep him postedAbsolutely horrible The wait here is simply unprofessional and uncalled for  My fiancé and I have been attending Penn Fertility for a year now  To deal with unpleasant receptionists, and then sit in rooms alone for 30-90mins waiting for a doctor or nurse is  incredibly frustrating If you can, avoid The center city location at all costs  This place is a complete waste of timePenn fertility is absolutely terribleFirst, I should be clear that my experiences were almost exclusively at 3701 Market Street, not the other locations  My doctor and nurse were fine, and if I was reviewing them, I would have given 3 1/2- 4 stars  Why?  The wait can be terrible - never less than 25 minutes and sometimes up to an hour  Maybe this isn't a big deal for most doctor's offices, but for fertility testing that occurs every other day, you need to be able to get in and out quickly  In most cases, I was only getting blood work done (that took less than 2 minutes)  At my previous clinic, I usually waited less than 10 mins and my worst wait in 4 months was 30 minutes (for which they were very apologetic)  Not at Penn Fertility  I am a quiet, follower typer personality and I am happy to do what you tell me to, as long as I'm not being mistreated  The main receptionist at 3701 Penn Fertility Care is one of the nastiest women I have ever met  It was a GREAT day when she was away from her desk or out of the office and someone else stepped in and possessed common courtesy  While this may seem like a small thing, she is the guard dog for the office and it is nearly impossible to see or talk with anyone without getting past herPenn Fertility Care has been knowledgeable, informative, and flexible with my husband and I as we navigated a very tricky fertility process They have also been individualized in their billing approaches-- they explain bills and ask you in person about them when you come in rather than just receiving a random disconnected bill The nursing staff is the same way
summary: That was our last visit We chose a different fertility clinic, one that's highly recommendedHorrible experience . I definitely wouldn't return to Penn fertility . He's supposed to be the best in this area . The only reason that I didn't give it 5 stars, by the way, is because I didn't feel the same amount of professionalism at the Market St location . Although, I really only went there on holidays and weekends, so they may have had a staff during the week who was also fabulous . But I always waited for ages at the Market St location- including one day when I was completely forgotten about when I was there for a monitoring appointment . I have been a patient at the office for two yearsThere are actually two head receptionists, Madeline and Teresa- both who have been incredibly kind to me in my many interactions in person and over the phoneYes- I have waited over 25 minutes on occasion, but that is NOT the norm . However, I have found that seeing more doctors has been great for me, as they are working as a team to care for me . They treat you with the most respect and careWe are very pleased with Penn Fertility . We interviewed several fertility clinics and ultimately chose Penn and could not be happier that we did . We cannot be happier and are over the moon with our little bundle of joy . We plan on using Penn again to make him a big brother soon . My fiancé and I have been attending Penn Fertility for a year now . incredibly frustrating If you can, avoid The center city location at all costs . My doctor and nurse were fine, and if I was reviewing them, I would have given 3 1/2- 4 stars . The wait can be terrible - never less than 25 minutes and sometimes up to an hour . In most cases, I was only getting blood work done (that took less than 2 minutes) . The main receptionist at 3701 Penn Fertility Care is one of the nastiest women I have ever met . While this may seem like a small thing, she is the guard dog for the office and it is nearly impossible to see or talk with anyone without getting past herPenn Fertility Care has been knowledgeable, informative, and flexible with my husband and I as we navigated a very tricky fertility process They have also been individualized in their billing approaches-- they explain bills and ask you in person about them when you come in rather than just receiving a random disconnected bill The nursing staff is the same way

Reviews: If you are gay, or single, you will most definitely be explicitly or implicitly discriminated against, and will be asked what your husband's name is on multiple occasions They're 100% accurate We started with penn sometime in the summer of 2018 They make my wife take a HSG test So after the HSG, they determined that my wife had a blocked tube (Fun Fact her tubes not blocked, these goofs can't apparently figure out their own test) So for months they would have my wife come into office 4-6's times a month to monitor the size of the follicles Well this is interesting because 2 days prior she apparently had no follicles on the right side So now my wife is apparently right side dominate this month Then the nurse thinking my wife's right tube is blocked says, hey maybe we try the iui this monthMy wife has to go through the ordeal of going to Penn Fertility frequently to have her follicles checked so she knows when to take the trigger shot to release the egg Last week she went in on Friday, her follicle was 17mm, Nurse Nicole told her to take the trigger shot that same day/nightMy wife took the shot at 5 PMEven more frustrating is that we sent/left multiple messages over the weekend to inquire how did this happen, and does it affect our chances this cycle is a huge disappointed for us, we just done with eggs retrieval on september 2017 but the embryo didn't last to blastocyst that's mean no embryos to transfer and no partial refund either according  they policy agreementwhat!! I mean if I knew it from the beginning I would not start my ivf program, we gonna fix our issue first and continue after that The HSG performed showed that both of my fallopian tubes were blocked I had mostly normal other results, but because I was 38 I should hurry into the process  I went for almost three years- multiple IUIs, and several losses  I will always remember their cheers when I finally "graduated" with my successful pregnancy actually the doctor is lack of the basic knowledge and scripted clomid he should not since I have thyroid disorder and fibroid, Then, as I took the clomid twice, got heavy bleeding, two cys (one is very big 3 cms), and no ovulation waited for three months to get my period back, and fibroid grew crazily after took clomid, FSH is doubled, My AMH is dropped by 60% (clomid speeded up using my egg reserve) In fact, the doctor should not script the hormone for me because levothyroxine  for my thyroid disorder should not be taken with clomid, which won't lead to ovulation and actually result in heavy bleeding as I want to know the ultrasound results as the clomid mess up my uterus and ovary, they said why you wanted to see the ultrasound results, go home, a nurse will call you and tell you everything Although my IVF pregnancy ended in miscarriage, he was a pleasant RE to work withI would recommend them Unfortunately, this is not the one of them I'm 4 days past my 3 day embryo transfer With severe endo, and issues with high estrogen and low ovarian reserve at 34-yrs-old, Dr Dokras transferred 2 grade 1 8 cell embryos I'm expecting a positive pregnancy test next week They will miscommunicate with each other They will occasionally give you a wrong dose of the med -- iI am an egg donor there  One comment was - well even if there is something we can fix, at your age, you just may not get pregnant  Even though I am not prusing IVF, and I will believe that the practice is one of the best in the country, I would not recommend Dr Sondheimer Especially when you have to do this multiple times in a week didn't even call me after I had an HSG  They do not do blood tests or ultrasounds throughout the month The other reason for my low rating is the receptionist
summary: I mean if I knew it from the beginning I would not start my ivf program, we gonna fix our issue first and continue after that The HSG performed showed that both of my fallopian tubes were blocked I had mostly normal other results, but because I was 38 I should hurry into the process . I went for almost three years- multiple IUIs, and several losses . I will always remember their cheers when I finally graduated with my successful pregnancy actually the doctor is lack of the basic knowledge and scripted clomid he should not since I have thyroid disorder and fibroid, Then, as I took the clomid twice, got heavy bleeding, two cys (one is very big 3 cms), and no ovulation waited for three months to get my period back, and fibroid grew crazily after took clomid, FSH is doubled, My AMH is dropped by 60% (clomid speeded up using my egg reserve) In fact, the doctor should not script the hormone for me because levothyroxine . One comment was - well even if there is something we can fix, at your age, you just may not get pregnant . Even though I am not prusing IVF, and I will believe that the practice is one of the best in the country, I would not recommend Dr Sondheimer Especially when you have to do this multiple times in a week didn't even call me after I had an HSG . They do not do blood tests or ultrasounds throughout the month The other reason for my low rating is the receptionist

Reviews: I've bumped up my star rating to 3/5 as a result Fun surprised when a 2400 dollar bill shows up because of our deductible Doing research the avg price for an HSG in Philadelphia is 400-600 Somehow at Penn it cost 4-5x the avg in the same city Then I started noticing they were charging us 2 co-pays per visit, from 2 separate doctors So every single visit we were being charged 120 dollars So every month we're looking at close to 500 dollars in co-pays for these constant ultrasounds Then the final straw We get approved for iui treatments from my insurance Magically my co-pay is 40 per visit and they don't charge us double Told us they're not sure why they would have to bill us twice for once visit  They wouldn't tell us the price of any fertility treatments ( not a range, not an average, no idea whatsoever ever of costs) until or unlessWe completed thousands of dollars in tests wThemTo be fair I fortunately did not have to go too far along in the processThe blood test and ultra sound exam will be charged separately and very expensive We had three failed IUI procedures with them; each time Penn charged us a co-pay and $150 for a "specimen thaw" which is part of a co-pay at other fertility clinicsMy insurance required that I go to Penn Fertility Care, so I had no choice
summary: They wouldn't tell us the price of any fertility treatments ( not a range, not an average, no idea whatsoever ever of costs) until or unlessWe completed thousands of dollars in tests wThemTo be fair I fortunately did not have to go too far along in the processThe blood test and ultra sound exam will be charged separately and very expensive We had three failed IUI procedures with them; each time Penn charged us a co-pay and $150 for a specimen thaw which is part of a co-pay at other fertility clinicsMy insurance required that I go to Penn Fertility Care, so I had no choice
